Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Data Scientist all‚Äôinterno della struttura Group Data Office. La struttura ha tra le principali responsabilit√† quella di supportare a livello di Gruppo l‚Äôindividuazione di utilizzi dei dati per estrarne il maggior valore possibile e supportare le unit√† locali nel Business nello sviluppo di use cases, nella realizzazione e nel miglioramento delle soluzioni di Advanced Analytics, anche promuovendo la diffusione di best-practice, standard e know-how.

Per quale societ√†

A2A S.p.A.

Ti occuperai di


Esplorazione e analisi di elevate moli di dati al fine di supportare l‚Äôelaborazione delle soluzioni di Advanced Analytics
Applicazione di tecniche statistiche avanzate, machine learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining (analisi time series, alberi decisionali, algoritmi di clusterizzazione come K-mean, random forest, reti neurali‚Ä¶) e tecniche di Intelligenza Artificiale Generativa
Collaborazione attiva con il team per supportare e implementare la messa in produzione dei progetti
Partecipazione proattiva all‚Äôinnovazione e all‚Äôottimizzazione dei processi aziendali


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in Data Science, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria, Informatica
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in ambito di tecniche di Advanced Analytics, modellazione e analisi statistica di elevate moli di dati
Consolidata esperienza nella gestione di database e data warehouse su larga scala (SQL/NoSQL), e l‚Äôutilizzo di tecnologie Big Data (Spark, ...)
Conoscenza avanzata di Python e delle librerie di Machine Learning
Conoscenza dei Cloud Provider Google (GCP), Amazon (AWS) e Microsoft (Azure)
Rappresenta un requisito fondamentale pregressa esperienza in data visualization: Microsoft Power BI, Django, Flask, Dash, Shiny
Rappresenta un requisito fondamentale esperienza o conoscenza di tecniche avanzate di Machine Learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining e Generative AI
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Completano il profilo: forte orientamento al team working e capacit√† di interfacciarsi con interlocutori a diversi livelli, pensiero critico e capacit√† di problem solving, attitudine a lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, collaborativo con organizzazione agile (startuplike)


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilit√†: settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto; flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; 60% di smartworking su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere:¬†assistenza sanitaria integrativa,¬†supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver,¬†offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti,¬†gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro:¬†promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull‚Äôetica e sulle pari opportunit√† garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversit√†.¬†
La selezione √® rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

  • Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
  • Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull‚Äôetica e sulle pari opportunit√† garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversit√†. 
 La selezione √® rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

 Scopri di pi√π sul Gruppo a2a:
 https://www.gruppoa2a.it/it/carriere/nostre-career-areas

Per conoscere il nostro processo di selezione e prepararti al meglio al colloquio:
 https://content.gruppoa2a.it/sites/default/files/2023-03/consigli-iter-selezione.pdf

Title: Machine Learning Python Expert
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by‚Ä¶


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Italian
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants‚Äô needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Data Scientist II (Remote)
HTML:
Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customisable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures and automated platforms based on data governance best practices. Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organisations to discover, value and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.

With a highly skilled team of over 130 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organisations with their data-driven transformation.

Take a look at our Handbook to discover our core values and processes.

üí∞RAL: ‚Ç¨ 38.5K - 48.5K

üíºThe Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist II to join our team: you should have in-depth knowledge of statistics, classical machine learning. Experience with timeseries analysis is required. Familiarity with MLOps practices and collaborative software development workflows is considered a plus.

üíªResponsibilities

  • Analyzes business requirements and determines a suitable solution autonomously, evaluating if an ML-based solution is feasible;
  • Good understanding of business requirements;
  • Develops and fine-tunes models through reproducible experiments;
  • Builds ML solutions incorporating software engineering quality standards (SDLC) and data engineering best practices;
  • Participates in the technical design of features with guidance;
  • Understands and optimizes and monitors model performances;
  • Prioritizes tasks with autonomy based on requirements and proper context.

üõ†Ô∏èRequirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science;
  • Previous experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer (+2years);
  • In-depth knowledge of at least one machine learning framework such as Tensorflow, PyTorch or scikit-learn;
  • Good Knowledge of programming languages including advanced Python patterns;
  • Familiarity with software lifecycle practices (testing, release, deploy) and git-based workflows;
  • Knowledge of MLOps practices;
  • Ability to explain ML results and limitations to tech and non-technical audiences;
  • Good project management skills;
  • Good communication skill;
  • Languages: both Italian and English;
  • Team Player.

üôåüèªWe Offer

  • Remote or smart working and work life balance;
  • Training monthly budget;
  • A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level;
  • Benefits and corporate welfare programs: meal vouchers, health fund provided, prizes, welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work;
  • Agile Nomads experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad;
  • The opportunity to attend one conference per year;
  • Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are;
  • Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.

üòäHow We Work

  • We don't like hierarchies: we work as a team;
  • We don't like bureaucracies; we prefer sense of responsibility;
  • We like data, certainly, so anything that is measurable;
  • We want to make a positive change in our industry;
  • Empathy, humility, collaboration, and willingness to challenge ourselves are the basis of our work.

This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Amplifon is an Italian multinational company and the global leader in hearing care solutions and services for retail expertise, customization, and consumer care. More than 20,300 professionals every day in a network more than 9,700 points of sale across 26 countries, give back the joy of hearing, feeling, and living to thousands of people across the world.

At Amplifon we believe people are the most important component of our success. Thanks to our best-in-class Hearing Care Professionals and front and back-office Teams, we are able to put the everyday taps, pops and splashes back into the lives of our customers. We believe that it‚Äôs only through strong investment in talent engagement, continuous professional development, support, and recognition that our people can exceed every limit and build a fulfilling career.

About the Role:

As an AI/Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and deploying AI solutions on our target AI platform. You will work closely with other team members to contribute to the evolution of our AI platform, define the best practices for AI development, and deliver impactful AI-driven solutions.

Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI solutions.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of our AI platform, including infrastructure and tooling.
Experiment with and evaluate different machine learning algorithms and techniques to solve specific business problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Follow best practices for AI development, including model versioning, data management, and code documentation.
Contribute to the definition and implementation of AI development best practices within the team.
Participate in code reviews and knowledge sharing sessions.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI/ML and related technologies.
Deploy and monitor AI models in production, ensuring performance and reliability.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI models and infrastructure.


Qualifications:


Master's degree in a scientific or engineering domain (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, etc.).
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in AI/Machine Learning engineering.
Proven experience with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) suite, specifically Vertex AI, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Cloud Scheduler, Cloud Composer.
Demonstrated experience in deploying AI use cases to production or significant experience in experimentation and model development lifecycle.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience with LangChain.
Solid understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively in a global team environment. ¬†¬†


Bonus Points:


Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with MLOps tools and practices.
Experience with Dataiku
Google Cloud certifications
Familiarity with other cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).


Amplifon is working on boosting a Winning Culture that will lead our employees towards the future, starting from the improvement of our Winning Workplace. Aligned to this goal, we offer a hybrid working policy, allowing employees to work 9 days/month remotely.¬†

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to lead the creation of data products and solutions, leveraging Machine Learning and Big Data capabilities.
You will be involved in the full E2E development lifecycle of our ML solutions, from data architecture design to final delivery and production maintenance.
You will also contribute to the development of our internal central assets, such as the feature store and shared libraries, through our MLOps frameworkWhat you can expect from us

Design
and develop data products by applying advanced ML and big data techniques.

Define data architectures
and pipelines to support scalable AI solutions.

Train, evaluate, and optimize Machine
Learning models for real-world applications.

Develop and maintain centralized
AI assets, including feature
stores and shared libraries.
Integrate and manage ML solutions within our MLOps framework for
seamless deployment
What we expect from you
University
degree in Computer Science, Engineering,
Mathematics, or Statistics.
4+
years of relevant experience in Data Science, AI, or ML Engineering.
Advanced
proficiency in Python and experience with big data engineering
practices.

Strong knowledge of ML and deep learning frameworks
(TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).

Hands-on experience with third-party data platforms (Databricks,
Foundry, Dataiku, etc.).

Expertise in MLOps frameworks and cloud-native AI services (MLFlow,
Azure Pipelines, Jupyter Notebooks).

A curiosity-driven
mindset with a passion for analyzing and transforming banking
processes through AI.
Our offer to you#MakeInnovationHappen: Work on cutting-edge AI solutions shaping the future of banking.
#UnlockYourPotential: Join a dynamic and stimulating environment with opportunities for growth.
#ComeAsYouAre: Be part of an inclusive, diverse, and global team.
#BalanceLifeAndCareer: Enjoy flexible working hours and a hybrid work model.
#EnjoyTheBest: Access our benefits platform with a dedicated budget to tailor perks to your needs.
About UniCredit GroupUniCredit is a pan-European Commercial Bank with a unique service offering in Italy, Germany, Central and Eastern Europe. Our purpose is to empower communities to progress, delivering the best-in-class for all stakeholders, unlocking a better tomorrow for our clients and our people across Europe. We serve over 15 million customers worldwide. They are at the heart of what we do in all our markets. Digitalisation and our commitment to ESG principles are key enablers for our service. They help us deliver excellence to our stakeholders and creating a sustainable future for our clients, our communities and our people.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We stand together in nurturing a workplace that welcomes diverse thinking and inclusive behaviors.

Making all voices heard and leveraging "diversity of thought" regardless of gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, ability, cultural background, we ensure sustainable growth and new business opportunities, a strong drive for innovation and creativity, as well as a general improvement of the work climate with positive impact on productivity, well-being and engagement of our people.

Title: Digital & Media - Data Scientist
Description:
Descrizione azienda




JAKALA √® un'azienda che lavora su dati, intelligenza artificiale e sviluppo di esperienze per generare un impatto significativo e duraturo a livello globale.

Presenti in oltre 30 citt√† in 21 paesi, i nostri team uniscono competenze su strategia, tecnologia, creativit√† e operations per offrire esperienze personalizzate e soluzioni trasformative ai nostri clienti, grazie al supporto di dati e intelligenza artificiale. I Jakalers sono un gruppo eterogeneo di oltre 3.000 persone, animate da passione, ambizione e idee brillanti. Proprio questa combinazione unica di talenti √® il fattore distintivo che ha ispirato il nostro purpose: Together to get there.




Creare un mondo migliore √® il nostro obiettivo ultimo: la nostra ambizione √® generare valore per tutti i nostri stakeholder in modo sostenibile, con particolare attenzione a etica, clima e qualit√†. Nel 2021, abbiamo scelto di diventare una Societ√† Benefit, dimostrando il nostro impegno di lungo periodo e la volont√† di proteggere i principi e i valori che ogni giorno guidano le nostre azioni.




Crediamo che la diversit√† sia la chiave del nostro successo e, per questo, siamo impegnati a creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, dove ciascuno possa sentirsi valorizzato per la propria unicit√†. Tutte le nostre opportunit√† di lavoro sono aperte ai candidati appartenenti alle categorie protette L.68/99.




Posizione




Per il potenziamento della Business Line Digital & Media ricerchiamo un Data Scientist con ottime capacit√† di lavoro in squadra, di apprendimento e di problem solving. Come Data Scientist verrai inserito nel Team Data e ti occuperai della progettazione, implementazione, gestione di processi big data e machine learning pipelines lavorando a stretto contatto con Data Engineers e Data Viz specialists.




Ecco un esempio delle attivit√† che seguirai:

Applicazione di modelli di Marketing Mix Model per valutare l'impatto dei canali media sulle vendite;
Applicazione di modelli di Attribuzione per il marketing;
Analisi dei Big Data per i nostri clienti su Data warehouse in Cloud come Google BigQuery o similare;
Applicazione di modelli di segmentazione, clustering, churn della customer base;
Utilizzo di modelli di Generative AI (OpenAI, Google, Open Source) applicati ad use-cases di marketing come creazione e generazione di contenuti, traduzione, generazione di immagini, valorizzazione di know how aziendale;




Requisiti

Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede:




Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Ingegneria o altre discipline scientifiche
Almeno 3-6 anni di esperienza nella progettazione di soluzioni analitiche in ambito gestione e analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics e machine learning
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per la Data Science: Python, SQL, R.
Passione/Interesse per il digital marketing
Familiarit√† con le principali soluzioni cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) o precedenti esperienze nel digital marketing costituiranno elemento preferenziale.
Capacit√† di lavorare in team
Buona conoscenza lingua inglese scritta e orale




Nice to have:




Conoscenza di base del framework di elaborazione di Big Data Spark
Precedenti esperienze lavorative nel marketing digitale, inclusa esperienza di consulenza
Esperienza / progetti con librerie di Bayesian Modeling.




Se investi tempo nel nostro percorso di Recruiting, avrai tutto il nostro impegno. E oltre.

La tua candidatura verr√† presa in carico da un Recruiter del nostro Team Talent Acquisition, che si prender√† cura di visionare il tuo CV e le informazioni fornite. Sar√† poi il tuo Recruiter di riferimento a ricontattarti per condividere il nostro feedback per te, indipendentemente dall‚Äôesito. Riceverai in ogni caso suggerimenti di sviluppo legati all‚Äôottimizzazione del tuo CV, spunti per consolidare il tuo percorso di carriera e insight sull‚Äôarena competitiva in cui sei inserit*. Niente AI: lo facciamo a mano, col cuore, per te.
Ogni ora che vorrai investire nel conoscere JAKALA te la restituiamo per conoscerti meglio: grazie all‚Äôiniziativa ‚ÄúYour Time Back‚Äù e la nostra partnership strategica con Unobravo, hai diritto ad un percorso di empowerment di sessioni equivalenti al numero di interviste che hai sostenuto e che potrai spendere come vorrai. Sappiamo che cercare lavoro pu√≤ essere sfidante: insieme a Unobravo vogliamo esserti vicini, anche se ancora non ci conosciamo.

Nice to have:


  • Conoscenza di base del framework di elaborazione di Big Data Spark
  • Precedenti esperienze lavorative nel marketing digitale, inclusa esperienza di consulenza
  • Esperienza / progetti con librerie di Bayesian Modeling.


Se investi tempo nel nostro percorso di Recruiting, avrai tutto il nostro impegno. E oltre.

  • La tua candidatura verr√† presa in carico da un Recruiter del nostro Team Talent Acquisition, che si prender√† cura di visionare il tuo CV e le informazioni fornite. Sar√† poi il tuo Recruiter di riferimento a ricontattarti per condividere il nostro feedback per te, indipendentemente dall‚Äôesito. Riceverai in ogni caso suggerimenti di sviluppo legati all‚Äôottimizzazione del tuo CV, spunti per consolidare il tuo percorso di carriera e insight sull‚Äôarena competitiva in cui sei inserit*. Niente AI: lo facciamo a mano, col cuore, per te.
  • Ogni ora che vorrai investire nel conoscere JAKALA te la restituiamo per conoscerti meglio: grazie all‚Äôiniziativa ‚ÄúYour Time Back‚Äù e la nostra partnership strategica con Unobravo, hai diritto ad un percorso di empowerment di sessioni equivalenti al numero di interviste che hai sostenuto e che potrai spendere come vorrai. Sappiamo che cercare lavoro pu√≤ essere sfidante: insieme a Unobravo vogliamo esserti vicini, anche se ancora non ci conosciamo.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Company description




Digital media, entertainment, and e-commerce brands are investing in AI, predictive analytics and personalization technologies to offer a digital experience that is unique to each consumer.




ContentWise is an industry pioneer in leveraging machine learning techniques to deliver bespoke digital customer experience for global brands such RAI, Telenor, Allente, Orange, United Cloud, Globo, Telecom Argentina, PCCW, and Telefonica.




ContentWise is a company of Moviri, a global software and professional services leader with long-standing relationships with hundreds of enterprise customers worldwide.




Founded in 2000, Moviri is today a multinational technology group with offices in Milan, Boston, Los Angeles, and Singapore.




Job Description




As a AI Engineer in the ContentWise team, you will be involved in a project related to:




Take the lead in tackling complex data science challenges, working independently to design and implement scalable, high-impact solutions.
Harness the power of AI‚Äîdevelop, train, and fine-tune machine learning models using cutting-edge techniques in Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Generative AI.
Own the data pipeline‚Äîcollect, extract, and aggregate massive datasets using Big Data paradigms, transforming raw information into high-quality, validated insights.
Bring AI to life‚Äîdeploy models seamlessly into production, ensuring they integrate smoothly with existing systems and deliver real-world value.
Push boundaries‚Äîoptimize algorithms for peak performance, efficiency, and reliability, turning innovative ideas into game-changing solutions.




Full-time position at the Milan Office on Hybrid Mode.




Qualifications




If you share our passion for the Data & AI field and possess the following characteristics, we are waiting for you:




Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Physics or STEM related field;
Programming expertise in languages like Python, C++, Java, or R, with hands-on experience in software development and building scalable applications.
Experience in top-tier Data Science libraries‚ÄîPandas, Scikit-Learn, Keras, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, and fastAPI‚Äîto power AI-driven solutions.
Familiarity with software development best practices, including version control (GIT) and collaborative workflows like Agile.
An interest in learning and applying modern development techniques, such as Continuous Integration & Delivery (CI/CD), to streamline AI projects.
Experience with data management‚Äîskilled in SQL and NoSQL database programming to structure, query, and optimize large datasets efficiently.
Familiarity with cloud and big data technologies, including AWS, GCP, or Azure, as well as distributed computing frameworks like Hadoop and Spark.
Hands-on experience or strong interest with containerization and orchestration tools, such as Docker and Kubernetes, to automate, scale, and streamline AI deployments.
A passion for AI and Machine Learning‚Äîexcited about developing and fine-tuning models in areas like Time Series Analysis, Clustering, Classification, Anomaly Detection, Computer Vision, NLP, and Generative AI.




Compensation & Benefits




Make a Real Impact joining ContentWise: we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals who want to be a driving force in their field, making a significant difference from day one.
Flexibility and Trust: from the moment you step in, you're not just an employee, but you're part of the team of talented colleagues. ContentWise value freedom and responsibility, giving you the autonomy to excel and contribute your best in Hybrid mode
Competitive Salary and Company Welfare: Your hard work deserves recognition! Enjoy a competitive salary that reflects your skills and dedication. As a part of our team, you'll also receive a company welfare package of ‚Ç¨600, useful for fuel, bills, as well as wellness and well-being!
Sustainability: in our office, you will always have access to fresh fruit thanks to Cortilia. In Moviri, we are committed to connecting conscious customers with local products and producers, all while prioritizing environmental and social responsibility.
Tech Your Way: choose your weapon in the tech battle! Whether you're team Mac or team Windows, we believe in equipping you with the tools that spark joy. After all, the only thing better than coding your next big idea is doing it on a laptop that suits your style!




Join our team




We cannot realize any of our ambitions or achieve any of our goals without the right talent. If this sounds like you, please apply now. It may be the start of your next chapter!

Join our team


We cannot realize any of our ambitions or achieve any of our goals without the right talent. If this sounds like you, please apply now. It may be the start of your next chapter!

Title: Data Scientist Internship- L 68/99
Description:
Cerved √® la Tech Company che aiuta imprese e istituzioni a proteggersi dal rischio e a crescere in maniera sostenibile.

Siamo leader nell'ambito dei prodotti e servizi integrati di Risk, Sales e Marketing Intelligence, Credit Management. Con Cerved Rating Agency siamo specializzati nella valutazione del merito di credito di imprese non finanziarie e registrati quale agenzia di rating europea.

Dal 2021, Cerved √® entrata in ION Group, uno dei pi√π grandi operatori FinTech sul mercato a livello internazionale in cui lavorano oltre 13 mila persone, con 60 sedi internazionali e oltre 4800 clienti in tutto il mondo insieme realizziamo soluzioni integrate per aiutare le imprese a prendere decisioni efficaci, semplificando i processi e mettendo al centro le persone.‚ÄØ

Sei una persona appassionata di dati e desideri far parte della trasformazione algo-driven in CERVED? Siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Junior Data Scientist che si unisca al nostro team di Collection Intelligence. Questa √® un'opportunit√† sfidante per chi desidera contribuire alla comprensione dei dati e all'estrazione di insight significativi per il nostro business.

La persona che cerchiamo si occuper√† di


Collaborare con il Collection Intelligence Manager per sviluppare metodologie e tecniche per l'analisi e la valutazione dei dati mediante modelli matematici e statistici.
Identificare, analizzare e interpretare i dati per individuare trend, pattern e opportunit√† di ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali.
Supportare le diverse aree aziendali nell'implementazione di strategie data/algo-driven sui sistemi gestionali aziendali.
Sviluppare reportistica per il monitoraggio dei principali KPI aziendali nell'ambito delle operazioni.


La persona che cerchiamo


Ha conseguito una laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Informatica o campo correlato.
Possiede forti doti analitiche e quantitative.
E‚Äô in grado di organizzare, analizzare e interpretare quantit√† significative di informazioni con attenzione ai dettagli.
Ha competenze in data modeling
Ha una conoscenza avanzata di Excel
Utilizza il linguaggio di programmazione Python.


Per Cerved la diversit√† e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali per permettere a tutti di esprimersi al meglio nell'ambiente lavorativo. Ci impegniamo tutti i giorni a capire, comprendere e sviluppare le potenzialit√† e a valorizzare la diversit√† delle nostre persone, che rappresentano il vero valore del nostro Gruppo.

Si valuta come sede di lavoro preferenziale San Donato Milanese (MI)

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
DATA SCIENTIST




Are you curious and ready to accept a new challenge in your career? Are you eager to join a dynamic company and bring innovation through your work and skills?

Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 1000 professionals working for more than 500 clients in 20 countries around the world.

We are looking for motivated and talented Data Scientists to join our Data Science team. You will have the opportunity to work on complex and innovative projects, using cutting-edge tools and collaborating with high-level professionals to face the challenges of the global financial market. If you are looking for a challenging environment where your curiosity and creativity can make a difference, this is the right opportunity for you.




RESPONSIBILITIES:




‚óè Analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data in banking and insurance, identifying useful patterns and insights to support business processes and decisions.

‚óè Design, develop and implement advanced machine learning, data mining and statistical models to solve complex problems in finance.

‚óè Collaborate in cross-functional teams to define project requirements and propose innovative solutions.

‚óè Contribute to the development of proprietary frameworks and algorithms to improve the performance of solutions offered to our clients.

‚óè Present complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders, making analysis results understandable.

‚óè Support customers in implementing solutions, ensuring knowledge transfer and customization.




REQUIREMENTS:




‚óè Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration and feature extraction.

‚óè Excellent knowledge of Python and the most important analytical libraries.

‚óè Knowledge of statistics, Machine Learning and major clustering, classification and regression algorithms

‚óè Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques, predictive modeling with the application of Machine Learning models, and data analysis.

‚óè Ability to creatively solve complex problems and propose innovative solutions.

‚óè Ability to rapidly prototype ideas/solutions with a critical/experimental approach to data analysis.

‚óè Good communication skills and ability to translate technical results into insights for non-experts.

‚óè Aptitude for teamwork, with strong orientation toward interdisciplinary collaboration.




NICE TO HAVE:




‚óè Experience with code versioning systems (git).

‚óè Experience in Pyspark development and working in big data platforms.

‚óè Knowledge of at least one major cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS).

‚óè Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)

‚óè Prior analytical experience in the financial industry




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:




‚óè Master's degree or PhD with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields

‚óè Experience in a corporate setting (including internships), preferably in finance or insurance




LOCATION:

Milan




WHAT WE OFFER:




COMPENSATION, WELFARE & BENEFIT




Our history, as well as our future, is based on the value of our people. Prometeia‚Äôs biggest investment is in our people and it concerns every aspect of professional life. We call it ‚ÄúTotal Compensation‚Äù and it is made of three elements: Compensation, consisting of a fixed and a variable component, a Welfare Plan active since 2015 ‚Äìwe were among the first companies in Italy to introduce it‚Äì, and Benefits, including all initiatives for the well-being of our people.




REMOTE WORKING

Flexibility is an intrinsic value of our way of working. In Prometeia, remote working is an organizational method based on trust. It results in benefits in terms of work/life balance, impact on the environment and optimization of company results through autonomy and empowerment of people.




PEOPLE PROGRAM

Our evaluation system is based on the full enhancement of our people and on continuous dialogue as a stimulus for regular, mutual professional and personal growth. Within the projects, several moments are dedicated to transparent discussions between managers and team members. This allows for reciprocal and prompt feedback. The process is fully digitalized and aimed at continuously improving the strategic growth of both the individual and the company.




TRAINING

Prometeia means continuous training. We provide an average of 11 days of training per year to our people, in person and online. We pay specific attention to younger colleagues, the protagonists of dedicated growth programs, and to the continuous sharing and internal transfer of know-how and skills. On-the-job training is also important and is made of immediate and direct confrontation with the market.




WIN/WIN POLICY

If you are one of our employees and you recommend a person who is later hired, you are entitled to a financial bonus! This is an important opportunity to contribute to the growth of Prometeia as a whole, by attracting acknowledged market professionals and new tech talents.




PHYGITAL MANAGEMENT

We have completely digitalized the management of our physical and virtual environments through the dedicated app Pr(Home)teia. Access to the office, remote working, workstations, meeting rooms, carpooling... everything is just a click away.




COMMUNITY

Our Community is highly diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities we actively cooperate with are stakeholders representing a great value for us in terms of trust and collaboration.




DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the recruitment phase to everyday life, promoted also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and uniqueness.




IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, territories and communities we operate in. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards recognizing the efficiency of the building in terms of energy and water savings, CO2 emissions reduction, and improvement of the ecological quality of interiors, materials and resources. In the Sustainability Report we outline the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda drafted by the UN in 2016, that we have been supporting since 2020.

Title: Data Scientist IV (Remote)
HTML:
Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customisable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures and automated platforms based on data governance best practices. Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organisations to discover, value and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.

With a highly skilled team of over 130 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organisations with their data-driven transformation.

Take a look at our Handbook to discover our core values and processes.

üí∞RAL: 60K ‚Äì70K + 4K bonus pack

üíºThe Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist IV to join our team.

üíªResponsibilities

  • Analyzes business requirements and determines a suitable solution autonomously, evaluating if an ML-based solution is feasible;
  • Mentors junior engineers;
  • Strong understanding of business requirements;
  • Skills in Stakeholder and Expectations management;
  • Challenges the team processes, looking for ways to improve;
  • Develops and fine-tunes models through reproducible experiments;
  • Builds ML solutions incorporating software engineering quality standards (SDLC) and data engineering best practices;
  • Participates in the technical design of features with guidance;
  • Understands and optimizes and monitors model performances;
  • Prioritizes tasks with autonomy based on requirements and proper context.

üõ†Ô∏èRequirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science;
  • Previous experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer (+6 years);
  • In-depth knowledge of statistics, classical machine learning;
  • In-depth knowledge of at least one machine learning framework such as Tensorflow, PyTorch or scikit-learn;
  • Good Knowledge of programming languages including advanced Python patterns;
  • Familiarity with software lifecycle practices (testing, release, deploy) and git-based workflows;
  • Knowledge of MLOps practices;
  • Ability to explain ML results and limitations to tech and non-technical audiences;
  • Good project management skills;
  • Good communication skill;
  • Languages: both Italian and English;
  • Team Player.

üôåüèªWe Offer

  • Remote or smart working and work life balance;
  • Training monthly budget;
  • A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level;
  • Benefits and corporate welfare programs: meal vouchers, health fund provided, prizes, welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work;
  • The opportunity to attend one conference per year;
  • Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.

üòä How We Work

  • We don't like hierarchies: we work as a team;
  • We don't like bureaucracies, we prefer sense of responsibility;
  • We like data, certainly, so anything that is measurable;
  • We want to make a positive change in our industry;
  • Empathy, humility, collaboration, and willingness to challenge ourselves are the basis of our work.

This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:

EY promuove la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l‚Äôinclusione, valorizzando l‚Äôunicit√†, indipendentemente da et√†, genere, abilit√†, esperienza, cultura, orientamento sessuale, religione, disabilit√† e background socioeconomico. Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.





About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.




What You'll Do

Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.



Requirements


5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.



Benefits



Working pattern and location

40 hours per week, permanent contract¬†
Monday - Friday
Hybrid role




Benefits

Meal Vouchers (‚Ç¨7 per working day)
26 days holidays + national bank holidays¬†
Individual training paths
Opportunity to develop and move within the company
National and international mobility options¬†
Yearly team activities
Food canteen at the office




MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as a Senior Data Scientist and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will drive fintech innovation by developing predictive models and data-driven solutions to optimize products and enhance business outcomes. You‚Äôll work closely with teams to integrate machine learning models into production and help shape the future of the Satispay ecosystem.

Your Mission


Deliver impact in fintech innovation. Develop and implement data-driven solutions to shape and optimize product lines, directly contributing to customer and business success.
Analyze and drive insights. Explore and interpret datasets to uncover actionable insights, influencing product design and financial decision-making processes.
Design predictive systems. Create and optimize predictive models for fraud and credit risk to enhance the reliability and accessibility of current and prospect offerings.
Deliver and maintain production-ready systems. Ensure seamless integration of analytic pipelines and machine learning models into production, focusing on system reliability, ongoing maintenance, and continuous training to adapt to changing data and business requirements.
Collaborate and integrate. Work closely with product managers, engineers, and other teams to incorporate data science solutions into Satispay ecosystem.
Stay ahead of trends. Continuously research and adopt cutting-edge techniques and tools to ensure a competitive edge in the fintech landscape.
Enhance a data-driven culture. Support decision-making and foster a data-first mindset by delivering clear, actionable insights across the organization.


Your Ideal Profile


Proven experience in data science and fintech. You hold a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field, paired with 3+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a similar discipline. Ideally, your background includes work in financial services, payments and credit risk modeling.
Technical excellence. You bring extensive experience with Python or R and are well-versed in machine learning libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. Strong skills in SQL and query optimization are considered as a plus.
Modeling and problem-solving expertise. You have a proven track record in predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and machine learning techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning.
Experience in fintech: Familiarity with financial services, credit risk modelling and payments is a strong plus.
Cloud platform proficiency. You have experience deploying machine learning models on cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a sharp eye for detail and the ability to execute complex projects. You communicate effectively, building trust and understanding across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for fintech and innovation. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative environments where your work directly shapes financial products.
Adaptability and continuous learning. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, staying on top of industry trends, tools, and techniques to maintain a leading-edge approach.


Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

üôÜüèª Join an international team to grow with

üè° Hybrid working policy

üçΩÔ∏è Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

üåê Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

‚≠ê Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

üöÄ Own part of Satispay‚Äôs success with our Stock Option Plan

üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Gear up with our tech equipment

ü•≥ Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious about our core values? Explore them here.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
As a Data Scientist in our team you will be involved in transforming large, complex data-sets into actionable insights, thus leveraging data to identify, quantify and realize tangible business value.

About This Vacancy

The work will mainly be conducted in project teams of various (technical) disciplines. It is crucial that you have a good overview of the possible applications of your expertise and that you are able to see beyond the numbers and be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers.

What We Expect From You


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or equivalent
2-3 years of experience
previous industry experience
strong working knowledge of C, C++, C#, Matlab, Python, R, Java
working knowledge of Hadoop, Spark, SQL and/or noSQL
working knowledge of common BI toolkits, such as Tableau, Qlikview
proven experience in modeling physical-technical problems, risk modeling, algorithm development, image processing and / or data analysis
experience with processing large data sets (> 1 TB) is considered a plus
experience with image processing is considered a plus
good oral and written communicative skills
stress resistant, team player and strong personality
fluent in English and Italian
serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC.


What You Can Expect From Us

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.

As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

Title: AI Developer - MILANO [DIG]
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come AI Developer.

Your Perspectives

Entra a Far Parte Del Nostro Team Digital Innovation - AI Center Of Excellence In Rapida Crescita e Partecipa Allo Sviluppo Di Rivoluzionarie Applicazioni Basate Su Tecnologie Di Intelligenza Artificiale. Avrai L‚Äôopportunit√† Di

  • Sviluppare progetti basati su algoritmi di intelligenza artificiale, sia per ottimizzazioni dei processi interni o per clienti che integrati in innovative soluzioni software;

  • Partecipare al ciclo di vita di un prodotto basato su AI, dall‚Äôanalisi del business case, al tuning dei modelli, allo sviluppo delle componenti applicative richieste dall‚Äôapplicazione fino alla realizzazione della User Experience ideale;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Operare in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;

  • Fornire supporto applicativo a soluzioni basate su moduli di Intelligenza Artificiale, Large Language Models e Computer Vision, sia esistenti che di nuova realizzazione.

Your unique strengths

  • Possiedi una laurea in discipline STEM;

  • Hai esperienza nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate su AI e sei interessato a lavorare con Large Language Models come OpenAI e tecniche di Computer Vision come OCR, YoLo, etc.;
  • Hai basi di Semantic Web e conosci l‚Äôarchitettura dei motori di ricerca evoluti (Elastic Search, Solr, Lucene);
  • Hai utilizzato strutture dati NoSQL (MongoDB o componenti dell'ecosistema Hadoop);
  • Conosci approfonditamente linguaggi di programmazione object oriented come Java/Scala, C++ o Python;
  • Sei capace di mettere in pratica tecniche di "Continuous Learning" al fine di cogliere opportunit√† da nuove tecnologie senza abbandonarti alla sola attivit√† di ricerca;
  • Possiedi tecniche di ascolto attivo, capacit√† di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza e curiosit√†, spiccato senso di responsabilit√† professionale;
  • Possiedi una conoscenza avanzata della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta).

Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprender√† con un‚Äôopportunit√† di carriera che ti far√† sentire al centro della societ√†, dell‚Äôinnovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.

Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversit√† e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunit√†, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Data Scientist - LLM model
HTML:
The Digital Evolution Company Of Today And Tomorrow

Progettiamo soluzioni end-to-end per la Digital Evolution gestendone ogni area, grazie alle nostre sei anime tecnologiche: LutechConsulting, LutechSolutions, LutechDigital, LutechCybersecurity, LutechServices e LutechCloud.

Requisiti

TAKE YOUR STEP INTO THE DIGITAL EVOLUTION.

Dai alla tua carriera l‚Äôaccelerata che sta aspettando: fai l‚Äôapplication ed entra in una realt√† unica nel suo genere.

La tua sede di lavoro potr√† essere Milano o Torino Potrai operare in modalit√† ibrida.

Lutech attua una politica di pari opportunit√† e accoglie le candidature senza operare alcuna discriminazione in base a razza, religione o convinzioni personali, origine etnica o nazionale, disabilit√†, et√†, cittadinanza, stato civile, inclusa convivenza di fatto e unione civile, orientamento sessuale, identit√† di genere, o qualsiasi altra condizione applicabile tutelata dalla legge.

Title: Scientist III, Data Sciences
Description:
Work Schedule

First Shift (Days)

Environmental Conditions

Office

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you‚Äôll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world‚Äôs toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

Location/Division Specific Information

The team focuses on commercial audience generation through audience segmentation, time-to-event analysis, recommendation engines, generative AI, and other forms of predictive modeling. You will work closely with experts throughout the company to develop tailored targeting strategies. Your work will be seen and used by fellow data scientists, collaborators within the business, sales representatives, and customers of Thermo Fisher. You will be expected to learn quickly and offer creative and effective solutions to novel challenges.

You will report to a member of the data science team and operate as a key asset within the Corporate Data Science Center of Excellence, a team comprised of data scientists, data engineers, business analysts, program/product managers, and others.

Key Responsibilities


Identify and embed within business functions throughout the company with high data science potential.
Move quickly to build proof of concepts, scalable solutions, and anything else required to drive business value quickly.
Leverage modern tools and techniques to develop novel insights.
Promote standard methodologies in the field, encompassing data warehousing, performance monitoring, and a balanced approach.
Work with senior members to build novel audience-creation and targeting strategies
Voracious pursuit of knowledge and an unwavering dedication to the scientific process


Keys to Success:

Education


Graduate degree in a quantitative field, such as statistics, economics, mathematics, etc.


Experience


Proven track record (3 to 6 years) applying industry standard data science tools to tackle previously unsolved problems
Ability to work independently with minimal day-to-day oversight


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities


Extensive knowledge and application of the scientific process in industry
Command of statistical topics, including distributions, hypothesis testing, and experiment design.
Sophisticated technical proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and others.
Proficiency with distributed computational frameworks, such as Spark
Foundational understanding in digital marketing, sales operations, and key performance indicators
Fluent English both written and spoken is required.

Title: AI Training Specialist
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by‚Ä¶


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Italian
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants‚Äô needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Cosa ti proponiamo

All‚Äôinterno della divisione ENG DIGITAL per la business line Eng AI&Data siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Data Scientist per progettualit√† legate al Machine Learning, AI e Data Science nella nostra unit√† di sviluppo di LLM proprietari.

Quali saranno le tue attivit√† e responsabilit√†?

Sarai Responsabile Di Attivit√† Di Analisi, Sviluppo e Implementazione Di Soluzioni Avanzate Di Basate Sul Machine Learning, AI e Generative AI All‚Äôinterno Di Un Team Di Data Scientist Ed AI Engineer. In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Delle Seguenti Attivit√†

  • Progettare e sviluppare soluzioni di AI/ML robuste e scalabili;
  • Ottimizzare algoritmi e modelli di AI/ML;
  • Supportare la gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita di progetti di Data Science e Artificial Intelligence, dalla concezione al deployment;
  • Redigere e mantenere la documentazione tecniche relativa a Soluzioni e Modelli di AI.

Qualifiche e competenze richieste

Qualifiche Richieste

  • Almeno due anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di soluzioni Python con le principali librerie per il Machine Learning (es. Scikit Learn) e per la visualizzazione (es. Matplotlib, Plotly, Bokeh, ecc.);
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôuso di framework di deep learning e NLP (es. PyTorch, Hugging Face, Langchain);
  • Esperienza nell‚Äôuso di sistemi di versionamento del codice (es. GIT);
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di valutazione delle performance di Algoritmi di AI;
  • Familiarit√† nello sviluppo di API, basate su architetture a microservizi;
  • Familiarit√† nell‚Äôuso di tecnologie cloud a supporto dello sviluppo dello sviluppo di soluzioni di AI, su almeno uno dei principali hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform);
  • Laurea in discipline informatiche, ingegneristiche o statistiche (Master o specializzazione in ambito Data Science vengono considerati un plus):
  • Buone capacit√† comunicative e di presentazione.

Competenze Aggiuntive Preferenziali

  • Conoscenze di base della teoria dei modelli generativi e LLM;
  • Conoscenza di framework e best practice per il serving LLM in Production (es. vLLM, LLMOps,
  • Pachyderm);
  • Esperienza nella creazione di soluzioni basate su container tramite l‚Äôuso di strumenti di virtualizzazione e scaling (es. Docker, Kubernetes);
  • Conoscenza delle piattaforme Cloudera e Databricks;
  • Conoscenza del framework Ray per il calcolo distribuito;
  • Esperienza nella redazione di documentazione tecnica;

Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?

  • Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo;
  • Proattivit√†, nell‚Äôanticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa;
  • Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi;
  • Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.

Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza.‚ÄØ

SEDE DI INSERIMENTO

Milano | Roma | Torino | Padova

L‚Äôannuncio √® rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunit√† di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

Title: AI Engineer, Internship, Italy - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

You‚Äôll be part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You‚Äôll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development life cycle
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics
Fluent in English and Italian


What You'll Bring

Requirements

Currently enrolled in a university master‚Äôs or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related fields:

Technologies


Programming: Python, Java/Scala
Frameworks/Libraries: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras
Data Processing: NumPy, Pandas, Apache Spark, Dask
Cloud Platforms: AWS (SageMaker, EC2), GCP (AI Platform), Azure (ML Studio)
DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Jenkins
Data Visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly/Dash, Tableau
Tools: Jupyter Notebooks, Google Colab, Git (GitHub/GitLab), MLflow, TensorBoard
Deployment: Flask, FastAPI, TensorFlow Serving, Streamlit


#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: 12687 - AI and Climate Change/Environment Researcher
Company: CMCC Foundation - Centro Euro Mediterraneo sui Cambiamenti Climatici
Description:
CMCC Position cod. 12666

Climate Solutions Researcher

Deadline: March 15th, 2025

What We Are Looking For

The CMCC European Institute on Economics and the Environment (EIEE) is looking to hire

a talented and motivated early career researcher to join our interdisciplinary team at the intersection of artificial intelligence and climate change research. The ideal candidate will bring innovative machine learning approaches to address complex environmental challenges, contributing to cutting-edge research that has the potential to make a significant impact on understanding and mitigating climate change.

About Us

CMCC Foundation is a cross-cutting scientific research center on climate change and its interactions with the environment, society, the world of business, and policymakers. Our work aims to stimulate sustainable growth, protect the environment, and develop strategies for the adaptation and mitigation of climate change. CMCC's core objective is to conduct cutting-edge science, to train the next generation of scientists at both national and international levels, and to be a beacon for climate modelling.

CMCC pursues fundamental and applied science with utmost scientific integrity, prioritizing data-driven science and providing data, information, and research results that can support informed public debate and decision-making processes. To achieve climate research objectives at the highest international standards, we invest in training all our talents, and strive to create a workplace where everyone can excel.

At CMCC you will find a strong, professional environment. Join an inclusive community that values diversity, where every voice is heard and respected. Help foster a culture of innovation and societal change, where individuals from all backgrounds can thrive and succeed.

To learn more about this opportunity and submit your application, please refer to the following:

Responsibilities

The successful candidate is expected to work on the following tasks which include but are not limited to:


Developing and implementing advanced machine learning and deep learning algorithms to analyze climate-related datasets;
designing and conducting independent research projects that leverage AI technologies to gain insights into climate systems;
participation in research projects, by collaborating with interdisciplinary teams of climate scientists, economists, data scientists, and domain experts
publishing research findings in peer-reviewed scientific journals and presenting at international conferences;
contributing to the development of new models and innovative AI approaches for climate change research


The job location is Milan, Italy.

Requirements

We are looking for a motivated person with the following requirements:


Master of Science (MSc) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or equivalent
2-3 years of research experience in machine learning, AI, or related fields
Demonstrated advanced programming skills in Python
Strong interest in applying machine learning techniques to climate change research
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative, interdisciplinary team
Demonstrated expertise in designing and implementing deep learning algorithms
Proficiency with modern machine learning tools, with particular expertise in PyTorch


Desirable:


PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or equivalent
Expanded record of publications in peer-reviewed scientific literature, specifically in machine learning and/or climate change domains
Demonstrated knowledge of uncertainty quantification in mathematical models
Advanced expertise in specific deep learning methodologies, including:
Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
Transformer architectures
Large Language Models (LLMs)
Deep reinforcement learning
Distinctive advantage: In-depth knowledge of foundation model design and implementation
Skills on computer vision applied to satellite data


Technical skills:


Advanced Python programming
Deep learning framework expertise (PyTorch)
Statistical analysis and machine learning techniques
Data preprocessing and feature engineering
Experience with climate/environment-related datasets
Version control (git)
Research and scientific writing


Duration, Compensation & Benefits


The appointment period will be initially 24 months, renewable for two additional years pending a positive evaluation. Tenure can be granted from 2 to 4 years after being appointed as a junior researcher.
The gross salary will be based on qualifications and working experience and competitive with major research centers in Europe
CMCC provides some additional benefits like welfare package, flexible working time, support during the immigration process, if needed


PROTECTED CATEGORY

Belonging to legally protected categories (ex L. 68/99) will constitute a preferential condition.

Some fiscal benefits could be applied for repatriated workers or foreign researchers/professors, having the requirements defined by Dlgs 147/2015 (for repatriates) or Dl 78/2010 (for foreigners).

CMCC is an equal-opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status, and other legally protected characteristics. Please omit from your CV any data you or we might consider discriminatory.

This job announcement is an invitation to express interest in the above-mentioned CMCC Position.

Applicants responding to this posting declare that they have read, understood and agreed to the ‚ÄúOfficial Rule for the CMCC Personnel recruitment".

We will keep your information on file for up to 1 year.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.





About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.




What You'll Do

Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.



Requirements


5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.



Benefits



Working pattern and location

40 hours per week, permanent contract¬†
Monday - Friday
Hybrid role




Benefits

Meal Vouchers (‚Ç¨7 per working day)
26 days holidays + national bank holidays¬†
Individual training paths
Opportunity to develop and move within the company
National and international mobility options¬†
Yearly team activities
Food canteen at the office




MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.
