HTML:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.



About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.


What You'll Do

  • Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
  • Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
  • Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
  • Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
  • Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.


Requirements

  • 5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
  • Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
  • Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
  • Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
  • Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.


Benefits

Working pattern and location

  • 40 hours per week, permanent contract 
  • Monday - Friday
  • Hybrid role


Benefits

  • Meal Vouchers (‚Ç¨7 per working day)
  • 26 days holidays + national bank holidays 
  • Individual training paths
  • Opportunity to develop and move within the company
  • National and international mobility options 
  • Yearly team activities
  • Food canteen at the office

Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Data Scientist II (Remote)
HTML:
Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customisable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures and automated platforms based on data governance best practices. Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organisations to discover, value and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.

With a highly skilled team of over 130 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organisations with their data-driven transformation.

Take a look at our Handbook to discover our core values and processes.

üí∞RAL: ‚Ç¨ 38.5K - 48.5K

üíºThe Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist II to join our team: you should have in-depth knowledge of statistics, classical machine learning. Experience with timeseries analysis is required. Familiarity with MLOps practices and collaborative software development workflows is considered a plus.

üíªResponsibilities

  • Analyzes business requirements and determines a suitable solution autonomously, evaluating if an ML-based solution is feasible;
  • Good understanding of business requirements;
  • Develops and fine-tunes models through reproducible experiments;
  • Builds ML solutions incorporating software engineering quality standards (SDLC) and data engineering best practices;
  • Participates in the technical design of features with guidance;
  • Understands and optimizes and monitors model performances;
  • Prioritizes tasks with autonomy based on requirements and proper context.

üõ†Ô∏èRequirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science;
  • Previous experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer (+2years);
  • In-depth knowledge of at least one machine learning framework such as Tensorflow, PyTorch or scikit-learn;
  • Good Knowledge of programming languages including advanced Python patterns;
  • Familiarity with software lifecycle practices (testing, release, deploy) and git-based workflows;
  • Knowledge of MLOps practices;
  • Ability to explain ML results and limitations to tech and non-technical audiences;
  • Good project management skills;
  • Good communication skill;
  • Languages: both Italian and English;
  • Team Player.

üôåüèªWe Offer

  • Remote or smart working and work life balance;
  • Training monthly budget;
  • A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level;
  • Benefits and corporate welfare programs: meal vouchers, health fund provided, prizes, welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work;
  • Agile Nomads experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad;
  • The opportunity to attend one conference per year;
  • Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are;
  • Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.

üòäHow We Work

  • We don't like hierarchies: we work as a team;
  • We don't like bureaucracies; we prefer sense of responsibility;
  • We like data, certainly, so anything that is measurable;
  • We want to make a positive change in our industry;
  • Empathy, humility, collaboration, and willingness to challenge ourselves are the basis of our work.

This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Title: Junior ‚Äì ML & RPA Developer
HTML:
Stiamo cercando una figura Junior da inserire nel team Digital Controls CPP di Deloitte per la sede di Milano e Roma che lavorer√† in modalit√† Hybrid.

Il business Digital Controls CPP si occupa di fornire servizi di Digital Transformation, che hanno l‚Äôobiettivo di supportare la digitalizzazione dei processi di business, mettendo in atto attivit√† che prevedono l‚Äôutilizzo di strumenti di Robotic Process Automation, Data Analytics, Machine Learning e AI sfruttando i principali servizi messi a disposizione dai pi√π importanti player del settore dell‚Äôautomazione di processo e cloud.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior verr√† inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuper√† di:

  • Aiutare nella progettazione e design di soluzioni IT sia di tipo applicativo che di integrazione;
  • Porter√† avanti attivit√† di troubleshooting e reverse engineering su soluzioni gi√† implementate;
  • Implementazione di nuovi processi di automazione a partire dall‚Äôanalisi di requisiti di Business fino al rilascio in produzione dopo opportuni Unit e User Acceptance Test.

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea triennale in informatica o in un campo STEM correlato;
  • Esperienza su progettualit√† di trasformazione digitale e/o automazione di processo;
  • Forte predisposizione al problem solving e mentalit√† analitica;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata);
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi C#, SQL, .Net‚Äô;
  • Ottime abilit√† comunicative nei confronti degli stakeholder di progetto (colleghi, cliente, etc.);
  • Voglia di imparare, propositivit√† e capacit√† di teamworking.

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte √® un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo √® supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilit√† √® un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualit√† legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la societ√†. Scopri di pi√π sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinch√© siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un‚Äôorganizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all‚Äôinterno e all‚Äôesterno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio √® stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell‚Äôinclusivit√†.

Title: Machine Learning Python Expert
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by‚Ä¶


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Italian
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants‚Äô needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Konecta √® un‚Äôazienda leader globale del settore BPO e Customer Management BPO con oltre 130.000 dipendenti appassionati che gestiscono interazioni in ben 30 lingue in 4 continenti e 25 Paesi nel mondo.

Il nostro approccio settoriale, focalizzato sulle specifiche esigenze e le opportunit√† che ogni settore offre ai nostri Clienti, ci permette di offrire una gamma completa di soluzioni per la gestione end-to-end dei clienti (acquisizione, ritenzione, servizio clienti, supporto tecnico e recupero crediti), tutte basate su un modello di business sostenibile. Queste soluzioni sono costruite su un portafoglio di servizi di livello mondiale che coprono la customer experience, la gestione dei processi aziendali e le tecnologie digitali pi√π all'avanguardia.

Con sede a Madrid, Konecta ha un fatturato globale di circa 2 miliardi di euro con pi√π di 500 clienti, tra cui alcuni dei pi√π grandi nomi delle telecomunicazioni, dell'energia, delle banche, della mobilit√† e automotive, del retail e dell'e-commerce.

All'interno di Konecta la BU Digital √® la divisione di innovazione e servizi del gruppo, riunisce le attivit√† di innovazione ed √® coinvolta nei vari progetti di trasformazione dei nostri clienti. Uniamo la nostra passione per la soddisfazione del cliente con una mentalit√† focalizzata su innovazione e tecnologia.

Posizione:

Per la Business Unit Konecta Digital cerchiamo Data Scientist qualificato da inserire all'interno del nostro organico.

PRINCIPALI ATTIVITA' E RESPONSABILITA:


DATA COLLECTION


Gestire la raccolta e l'individuazione dei dati, cercando di capire la fattibilit√† del prelievo dei dati e quali strumenti utilizzare;


DATA EXTRACT


Studiare il framework, ossia quale strumento utilizzare tra i vari sistemi disponibili sul mercato per estrarre, catalogare, trasformare e valutare i dati in suo possesso in modo anche da distribuirli nel framework pi√π opportuno;


DATA EXPLORATION AND CLEASING


Provvedere, una volta attuata l'estrapolazione dei dati, alla loro ripulitura da eventuali inutili sovraccarichi, dunque al loro rimaneggiamento e schematizzazione;


DATA ANALYTICS


Gestire lo sviluppo di metriche come la correlazione, comparazione e statistica ed elaborare ipotesi analitiche da applicare successivamente in azioni di machine learning;


MACHINE LEARNING


Garantire il controllo del livello di complessit√†, tramite algoritmi gi√† collaudati come il Random Forest, e verificare delle ipotesi sviluppate in fase Analytics;


IMPLEMENTAZIONE AI (ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE)


Fornire una proposta di azione effettiva all'Intelligenza Artificiale, sfruttando la lavorazione dei dati strutturati e non strutturati e le risposte ottenute dalle dinamiche di Machine learning;


TEXT MINING


Comprendere lo stato dell'arte del text mining e dell'analisi del sentiment, progettare e sviluppare metodi per la classificazione del testo e la modellazione degli argomenti.

Requisiti:

Statistica:


conoscenza di metodi statistici e probabilistici per l'analisi dei dati.


Programmazione:


conoscenza di Python e SQL;
conoscenza di piattaforme quali Databricks, Celery, Kubernetes, Airflow rappresentano un elemento distintivo.


Machine Learning:


esperienza nel training, tuning e valutazione di modelli di Machine Learning;
esperienza con librerie e framework di Machine Learning come PyTorch e Scikit-Learning;
esperienze con librerie per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate su modelli LLM;

HTML:
Konecta √® un‚Äôazienda leader globale del settore BPO e Customer Management BPO con oltre 130.000 dipendenti appassionati che gestiscono interazioni in ben 30 lingue in 4 continenti e 25 Paesi nel mondo.

Il nostro approccio settoriale, focalizzato sulle specifiche esigenze e le opportunit√† che ogni settore offre ai nostri Clienti, ci permette di offrire una gamma completa di soluzioni per la gestione end-to-end dei clienti (acquisizione, ritenzione, servizio clienti, supporto tecnico e recupero crediti), tutte basate su un modello di business sostenibile. Queste soluzioni sono costruite su un portafoglio di servizi di livello mondiale che coprono la customer experience, la gestione dei processi aziendali e le tecnologie digitali pi√π all'avanguardia.

Con sede a Madrid, Konecta ha un fatturato globale di circa 2 miliardi di euro con pi√π di 500 clienti, tra cui alcuni dei pi√π grandi nomi delle telecomunicazioni, dell'energia, delle banche, della mobilit√† e automotive, del retail e dell'e-commerce.

All'interno di Konecta la BU Digital √® la divisione di innovazione e servizi del gruppo, riunisce le attivit√† di innovazione ed √® coinvolta nei vari progetti di trasformazione dei nostri clienti. Uniamo la nostra passione per la soddisfazione del cliente con una mentalit√† focalizzata su innovazione e tecnologia.

Posizione:

Per la Business Unit Konecta Digital cerchiamo Data Scientist qualificato da inserire all'interno del nostro organico.

PRINCIPALI ATTIVITA' E RESPONSABILITA:

  • DATA COLLECTION

Gestire la raccolta e l'individuazione dei dati, cercando di capire la fattibilit√† del prelievo dei dati e quali strumenti utilizzare;

  • DATA EXTRACT

Studiare il framework, ossia quale strumento utilizzare tra i vari sistemi disponibili sul mercato per estrarre, catalogare, trasformare e valutare i dati in suo possesso in modo anche da distribuirli nel framework pi√π opportuno;

  • DATA EXPLORATION AND CLEASING

Provvedere, una volta attuata l'estrapolazione dei dati, alla loro ripulitura da eventuali inutili sovraccarichi, dunque al loro rimaneggiamento e schematizzazione;

  • DATA ANALYTICS

Gestire lo sviluppo di metriche come la correlazione, comparazione e statistica ed elaborare ipotesi analitiche da applicare successivamente in azioni di machine learning;

  • MACHINE LEARNING

Garantire il controllo del livello di complessit√†, tramite algoritmi gi√† collaudati come il Random Forest, e verificare delle ipotesi sviluppate in fase Analytics;

  • IMPLEMENTAZIONE AI (ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE)

Fornire una proposta di azione effettiva all'Intelligenza Artificiale, sfruttando la lavorazione dei dati strutturati e non strutturati e le risposte ottenute dalle dinamiche di Machine learning;

  • TEXT MINING

Comprendere lo stato dell'arte del text mining e dell'analisi del sentiment, progettare e sviluppare metodi per la classificazione del testo e la modellazione degli argomenti.

Requisiti:

Statistica:

  • conoscenza di metodi statistici e probabilistici per l'analisi dei dati.

Programmazione:

  • conoscenza di Python e SQL;
  • conoscenza di piattaforme quali Databricks, Celery, Kubernetes, Airflow rappresentano un elemento distintivo.

Machine Learning:

  • esperienza nel training, tuning e valutazione di modelli di Machine Learning;
  • esperienza con librerie e framework di Machine Learning come PyTorch e Scikit-Learning;
  • esperienze con librerie per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate su modelli LLM;
  • esperienze con librerie di Text Mining.

Databae:

  • conoscenza di database relazionali e non relazionali come MySQL, PostogreSQL, Mongo DB.

Sviluppo API/Webapp:

  • competenze nello sviluppo do applicazioni web utilizzando framework come Flash o Django.

Altre informazioni:

Costituisce un elemento preferenziale la Laurea in discipline STEM.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Data Scientist all‚Äôinterno della struttura Group Data Office. La struttura ha tra le principali responsabilit√† quella di supportare a livello di Gruppo l‚Äôindividuazione di utilizzi dei dati per estrarne il maggior valore possibile e supportare le unit√† locali nel Business nello sviluppo di use cases, nella realizzazione e nel miglioramento delle soluzioni di Advanced Analytics, anche promuovendo la diffusione di best-practice, standard e know-how.

Per quale societ√†

A2A S.p.A.

Ti occuperai di


Esplorazione e analisi di elevate moli di dati al fine di supportare l‚Äôelaborazione delle soluzioni di Advanced Analytics
Applicazione di tecniche statistiche avanzate, machine learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining (analisi time series, alberi decisionali, algoritmi di clusterizzazione come K-mean, random forest, reti neurali‚Ä¶) e tecniche di Intelligenza Artificiale Generativa
Collaborazione attiva con il team per supportare e implementare la messa in produzione dei progetti
Partecipazione proattiva all‚Äôinnovazione e all‚Äôottimizzazione dei processi aziendali


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in Data Science, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria, Informatica
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in ambito di tecniche di Advanced Analytics, modellazione e analisi statistica di elevate moli di dati
Consolidata esperienza nella gestione di database e data warehouse su larga scala (SQL/NoSQL), e l‚Äôutilizzo di tecnologie Big Data (Spark, ...)
Conoscenza avanzata di Python e delle librerie di Machine Learning
Conoscenza dei Cloud Provider Google (GCP), Amazon (AWS) e Microsoft (Azure)
Rappresenta un requisito fondamentale pregressa esperienza in data visualization: Microsoft Power BI, Django, Flask, Dash, Shiny
Rappresenta un requisito fondamentale esperienza o conoscenza di tecniche avanzate di Machine Learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining e Generative AI
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Completano il profilo: forte orientamento al team working e capacit√† di interfacciarsi con interlocutori a diversi livelli, pensiero critico e capacit√† di problem solving, attitudine a lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, collaborativo con organizzazione agile (startuplike)


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilit√†: settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto; flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; 60% di smartworking su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere:¬†assistenza sanitaria integrativa,¬†supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver,¬†offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti,¬†gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro:¬†promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull‚Äôetica e sulle pari opportunit√† garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversit√†.¬†
La selezione √® rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Per conoscere il nostro processo di selezione e prepararti al meglio al colloquio:
https://content.gruppoa2a.it/sites/default/files/2023-03/consigli-iter-selezione.pdf

Title: Senior Specialist - Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

We‚Äôre looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you‚Äôll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of topics.







Activities

Apply data workflow tasks as extraction, mining, preparation, quality control, KPI optimization, modelling, validation and business insight consideration.
Apply advanced analytics techniques in a big data paradigm considering multiple data sources
Develop and deploy machine/deep learning models applied to cross-functional use cases to increase customer value or operational efficiency.







Preferred Qualifications

A Master‚Äôs Degree in a highly quantitative field (Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, etc.) or equivalent experience
3+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling, data science and analysis
Fluent in data wrangling and preparation: exploratory analysis, profiling & cleansing, feature selection, feature engineering, segmentation, clustering and PCA
Strong working knowledge on programming languages as Python, SQL, R, data science libraries (Pandas, Scikit-learn, XGBoost) and MLOps tools (Git, Airflow, Kubernetes)
Experience using ML/DP libraries, such as scikit-learn, caret, mlr, mllib, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Experience with cloud resources, usage of IDE (PyCharm, visualbasic) and version control systems (git) are highly valued
Experience working with GPUs to develop models
Preferred experience with Natural Language and Cognitive applications
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Fluent in Italian and English
Familiarity with digital marketing or advertising is a plus

Job Description

We‚Äôre looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you‚Äôll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of topics.



Activities

  • Apply data workflow tasks as extraction, mining, preparation, quality control, KPI optimization, modelling, validation and business insight consideration.
  • Apply advanced analytics techniques in a big data paradigm considering multiple data sources
  • Develop and deploy machine/deep learning models applied to cross-functional use cases to increase customer value or operational efficiency.



Preferred Qualifications

  • Fluent in data wrangling and preparation: exploratory analysis, profiling & cleansing, feature selection, feature engineering, segmentation, clustering and PCA
  • Strong working knowledge on programming languages as Python, SQL, R, data science libraries (Pandas, Scikit-learn, XGBoost) and MLOps tools (Git, Airflow, Kubernetes)

  • Preferred experience with Natural Language and Cognitive applications

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Fluent in Italian and English
  • Familiarity with digital marketing or advertising is a plus

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Saipem is a global leader in the engineering and construction of major projects for the energy and infrastructure sectors, both offshore and onshore. Saipem is ‚ÄúOne Company‚Äù organized into five business lines - Asset Based Services, Energy Carriers, Offshore Wind, Sustainable Infrastructures, Robotics & Industrialized Solutions. The company has 8 fabrication yards and an offshore fleet of 29 construction vessels (of which 26 owned and 3 owned by third parties and managed by Saipem) and 15 drilling rigs, of which 8 owned. Always oriented towards technological innovation, the company‚Äôs purpose is ‚ÄúEngineering for a sustainable future‚Äù. As such Saipem is committed to supporting its clients on the energy transition pathway towards Net Zero, with increasingly digital means, technologies and processes geared for environmental sustainability. Listed on the Milan Stock Exchange, it is present in more than 50 countries around the world and employs about 30,000 people of over 120 nationalities.

Always committed to promoting and supporting the values of diversity and inclusion, Saipem confirms its commitment to valuing differences as a source of mutual enrichment. To this end, it promotes and encourages conditions that allow the removal of every obstacle that limits the full expression of people and their complete development within the organization. It protects and guarantees work conditions that respect individual dignity, while promoting a collaborative, harmonious, fair and supportive work environment.

The resource will be part of the important transformation program that involves all Saipem Group and plays a key role in ensuring Digital Transformation projects meet objectives and she/he will govern the data management architectures and the related technology authority methodologies.

The resource will contribute on transformation initiatives related to existing technologies, focusing also on new project digital imprinting leveraging on new technology introduction to meet project requirements.

The Person Will Focus On These Areas


Responsible for designing and evolving of Data Technologies and Data Architecture for the Group.
Identification and selection of new solutions offered by the major Technology Providers.
Ensure that applications and data related services during their evolution are sustainable, maintainable and efficient.
Guide and develop the Data Governance processes and environments, contributing to the definition of the technological and procedural guidelines for the Group.
Guide and develop Machine Learning environment and initiatives.
Design and maintain the lifecycle of data integration and data virtualization tools and services.
Manage project initiatives and govern their delivery.
Support and improve the internal data platform and data ops tools leveraging the new paradigms of data mesh and data fabric.
Ensure that information security risks are properly identified, assessed and managed.



From a Technical Point Of View, Required Knowledges Are


In-depth knowledge of Cloud data platforms and related catalogue offers for the ‚Äòend to end‚Äô design of the data Enterprise architecture.
Excellent knowledge of Informatica, Cloudera and Denodo.
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure environment.
Knowledge of IoT platform and Edge applications will be considered a plus.
Knowledge of cloud computing and the specific features of IaaS, PaaS and SaaS services.
Good knowledge of the Dev & Ops and IAC paradigms and management/evolution of CI / CD pipelines.
Familiarity with relevant data tools and technologies is beneficial. This may include experience with databases (e.g., Sql-and NoSql based databases), data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, PowerBI), and data analysis platforms (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow).
Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL, is highly desirable. Understanding how to write efficient code and work with data-related libraries and frameworks can significantly help.



Competencies / Experience Are


At least 5 years of experience in data management teams, technology system integration or Vendor player and 5 years‚Äô experience in the technology transformation journey and Cloud technologies.
A degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline is mandatory together with a strong foundation in STEM subjects.
Experience of working on large-scale software projects.
Fluency in English.
Good communication skills, flexible and adaptable, collaborative, enthusiastic with a high level of energy, self‚Äìmotivation, resilience, drive and initiative.
Availability to possible business trips.
Proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving is crucial. This includes the ability to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret data effectively. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methods, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization, would be advantageous.

  • Experience of working on large-scale software projects.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
As a Data Scientist in our team you will be involved in transforming large, complex data-sets into actionable insights, thus leveraging data to identify, quantify and realize tangible business value.

About This Vacancy

The work will mainly be conducted in project teams of various (technical) disciplines. It is crucial that you have a good overview of the possible applications of your expertise and that you are able to see beyond the numbers and be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers.

What We Expect From You


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or equivalent
2-3 years of experience
previous industry experience
strong working knowledge of C, C++, C#, Matlab, Python, R, Java
working knowledge of Hadoop, Spark, SQL and/or noSQL
working knowledge of common BI toolkits, such as Tableau, Qlikview
proven experience in modeling physical-technical problems, risk modeling, algorithm development, image processing and / or data analysis
experience with processing large data sets (> 1 TB) is considered a plus
experience with image processing is considered a plus
good oral and written communicative skills
stress resistant, team player and strong personality
fluent in English and Italian
serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC.


What You Can Expect From Us

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.

As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.
Show more

As a Data Scientist in our team you will be involved in transforming large, complex data-sets into actionable insights, thus leveraging data to identify, quantify and realize tangible business value.

About This Vacancy

The work will mainly be conducted in project teams of various (technical) disciplines. It is crucial that you have a good overview of the possible applications of your expertise and that you are able to see beyond the numbers and be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers.

What We Expect From You

  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or equivalent
  • 2-3 years of experience
  • previous industry experience
  • strong working knowledge of C, C++, C#, Matlab, Python, R, Java
  • working knowledge of Hadoop, Spark, SQL and/or noSQL
  • working knowledge of common BI toolkits, such as Tableau, Qlikview
  • proven experience in modeling physical-technical problems, risk modeling, algorithm development, image processing and / or data analysis
  • experience with processing large data sets (> 1 TB) is considered a plus
  • experience with image processing is considered a plus
  • good oral and written communicative skills
  • stress resistant, team player and strong personality
  • fluent in English and Italian
  • serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC.

What You Can Expect From Us

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.

As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

Title: AI Training Specialist
Description:
Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by‚Ä¶


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Italian
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants‚Äô needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Department

At Sappi, our Digital Transformation team thrives on tackling business challenges by harnessing the power of analytics, AI, and user-centric design. Driven by a passionate group of data and analytics experts, we optimise processes, uncover valuable insights, and empower proactive decision-making to drive success. Join us as we innovate and transform the future

Role and Responsibilities

In this role you will report to the Head of Data Analytics (based in Brussels).

You will be responsible for:

Collaborating with various teams to analyze key business problems and develop innovative ML solutions, continuously delivering valuable output.
Designing and implementing scalable machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions into daily operations.
Establishing testing, monitoring and continuous improvement of ML processes.
Making relevant, detailed, well-structured data available for analytics
Applying data science best practices focusing on data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation. Enable rapid prototyping and evaluation.

Required Qualifications

Experience developing and optimizing scalable machine learning solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS).
Strong expertise in ML operations and coding with Python; knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, adaptable to both technical and business audiences.
Intellectual curiosity and a degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering).
Fluent in English.

Traveling:

It is expected to have some traveling (up to 10%) to the locations of group.

What we offer:

An excellent opportunity to work, learn & grow with us. With our culture of learning & development, you can access thousands of online trainings
A multi-cultural & international environment to share and collaborate with colleagues from more than 68 nationalities in 31 locations globally.
A unique opportunity to join a global wood fibre solution company. We are constantly innovating toward a circular economy working to achieve our sustainability goals & reduce our carbon foot print.
Friendly atmosphere and team-work oriented culture
Work-life balance
Training opportunities

All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neurodiversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist (Financial Sector) ‚Äì Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist to support our financial analytics and machine learning initiatives in Brussels. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will apply data science, AI, and predictive modeling to enhance financial decision-making, risk assessment, and customer insights.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning models for financial forecasting, risk analysis, and fraud detection.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on large financial datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources, ensuring quality and consistency.
Build and optimize predictive models, including time-series forecasting, credit scoring, and anomaly detection.
Automate data pipelines and improve data workflows for real-time analytics.
Collaborate with finance, risk, compliance, and IT teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Create clear visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or R for data science and machine learning.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of financial statistics, risk modeling, and time-series analysis.
Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for deploying and monitoring ML models.

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated and able to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail, especially regarding financial data accuracy.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, insurance, fintech).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Experience in credit risk modeling, fraud detection, and algorithmic trading.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid ‚Äì On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or email me directly at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G‚Äôs supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G‚ÄôS SUCCESS:

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists ‚Äúroll up their sleeves‚Äù, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


YOUR ADVANTAGES:


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees‚Äô commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.

We are the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G, we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?

In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.

As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.

Responsibilities

Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository


Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it‚Äôs robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standards.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.


Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions


Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus‚Äô context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.


Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence


Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.


Education


Master‚Äôs degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.


Professional Experience


Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Technical Skills


Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.


Languages


Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About the Company

Our client is an innovative real estate company committed to enhancing the way people interact with the real estate market. Their mission is to leverage cutting-edge technology to provide exceptional user experiences. They are building a state-of-the-art large language model (LLM) function for their website to revolutionize customer interactions and simplify property searches.




Role Overview

The client is seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to develop, implement, and optimize a large language model for their platform. The role involves creating intelligent, user-focused solutions that transform the Real Estate experience. This position is fully remote, requiring availability during EU business hours.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy LLM-based features tailored to the client's real estate platform.
Implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to enhance LLM performance and relevance.
Fine-tune pre-trained models (e.g., GPT, Llama, etc.) to meet specific business and user needs.
Integrate LLM capabilities into the client's website to enable natural language search, chatbot functionality, and personalized property recommendations.
Collaborate with front-end and back-end development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI-powered solutions.
Optimize model performance for speed, accuracy, and cost-efficiency.
Conduct thorough testing and validation to ensure reliability and scalability.
Stay informed of the latest advancements in machine learning and natural language processing.




Key Skills & Qualifications

Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning and NLP models, particularly large language models.
Strong expertise in Python and ML frameworks/libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face Transformers.
Hands-on experience with fine-tuning pre-trained LLMs for specific applications.
Knowledge of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and its implementation.
Familiarity with APIs and integration of AI solutions into web applications.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure for deploying ML models.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a results-driven approach.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in remote team environments.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client‚Äôs needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client‚Äôs needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)‚Ä¶
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java ‚Ä¶
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM‚Äôs and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM‚Äôs (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist Prompt Engineer
Description:
Mercier Consultancy is seeking a talented Data Scientist Prompt Engineer to join our dynamic team. As an integral part of our organization, you will leverage your expertise in data science and artificial intelligence to develop and refine prompt engineering techniques that enhance the functionality and performance of our data-driven solutions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement innovative models that meet the diverse needs of our clients while pushing the boundaries of technology. Your role will be pivotal in transforming complex data into actionable insights, and your creative input will assist in driving strategic decision-making processes. With us, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that impact various industries, from technology and finance to healthcare and beyond.

We are looking for an external consultant who can help us to use new generative AI tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to improve our employee productivity and efficiency in our standard activities. The consultant will work with different business users from different parts of the bank, such as marketing, sales, and back office, and with different profiles, such as managers, project managers, sales people, etc.

Responsibilities


Design and create the prompts that can elicit the best responses from the generative AI tools, using prompt engineering techniques and best practices
Understand the business needs: Identify the use cases, the business need and scenarios where our generative AI tools can add value and solve problems
Test and evaluate the quality and accuracy of the generative AI tools' outputs, using appropriate metrics and feedback mechanisms
Train and coach the business users on how to use the generative AI tools effectively and responsibly and begin to set in place a prompt academy
Document and communicate the results and learnings of the project



Requirements


Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Experience with machine learning frameworks and prompt engineering techniques
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to non-technical audiences
Knowledge of data visualization tools and methodologies
You have at least a Master's degree in a quantitative discipline, such as statistics, mathematics, engineering (a PhD is considered an advantage) or MBA
Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial knowledge of prompt engineering technics are also encouraged to apply
Fluent in Dutch, French and English
Team player
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Good Communication and Influencing skills
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
Thinks out of the box outside existing processes and frameworks
Works with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company's success
Constructive by being open to the changes and to other's opinions, ideas and feedback


Benefits

Competitive Monthly Salary

Working for a worldwide multinational

50% from home - 50% from location

And more....

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization‚Äôs infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
About the Role

We are looking for an AI engineer who wants to help shape the future of retail and our company. As an early stage engineer you will:

Work directly with our founding team.

Apply the latest AI techniques to solve real world problems.

Design, build, and refine datasets to evaluate and continuously improve our products.

Ship features that our users care about, wherever they are in the stack.

Participate in strategy and product ideation sessions, influencing our product roadmap.

Working at Marx AI will be hard work, it will be messy and at times it will be stressful. However, you will:

Identify and help build innovative cutting-edge solutions

Shape the company's vision and will have a direct impact on its success

Have the opportunity for fast career growth and learning

Have the opportunity to participate in growing venture




Apply if:

You have experience with our stack: Python, LlamaIndex / LangChain, PyTorch, HuggingFace, FastAPI, Postgres, SQLAlchemy, Alembic, OpenAI, Docker, Azure, Typescript, React.

You have hands-on experience working with LLMs, RAG architectures, NLP, or applying Machine Learning to solve real-world problems.

You have a strong track record of building datasets for training and/or evaluating machine learning models

You enjoy diving deep into the domain, understanding the problem, and focusing on delivering value to the customer

You thrive in a fast paced environment

You like to take ownership and work independently

You are excited about joining an early-stage venture




Not applicable if:

You want to work on a single layer of the application.

You prefer to work on well-defined problems.

You need clear, pre-defined processes.

You prefer a low-pressure environment.

Title: AI /NLP/ ML Expert (SNS01090)
Description:
Job Description

We currently have a vacancy for an AI /NLP/ ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium.


The work will be carried out either on the company‚Äôs premises or on site at the customer premises.
In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client‚Äôs IT team on site.


Your tasks


Integration and maintenance of software applications or services in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in different technologies such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), Information Extraction, Knowledge Graphs (KG) or Graph Data Science (GDS)
Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data
Prompt engineering on Large Language Models and validation of results with the business/policy officers
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
Œônteracting with policy officers, data stewards and other stakeholders to understand business and data needs, turn them into use cases, prototypes or statements of work and eventually support the solution acceptance process
Defining data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality, integrity and Performance
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Designing the IT architecture and hosting solutions and coordinate its implementation considering cloud technologies, containers, DevOps, master- and metadata management concepts and security
Contributing to the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and deriving the IT requirements.


Requirements


Master‚Äôs degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT
At least 8 years of specific expertise in Perl, Python, Matlab, R and their NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas)
At least 8 years of specific expertise in machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks
At least 8 years of specific expertise in Large Language Model prompt engineering.
At least 7 years of specific expertise in query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc and with information extraction
At least 5 years of specific expertise in data management and analytics, including data quality, and advanced data retrieval tools
At least 5 years of specific expertise in AWS, Azure or other cloud platforms
At least 5 years of specific expertise in machine learning systems lifecycle
At least 5 years of specific expertise software development methodologies such as Agile or RUP
At least 5 years of specific expertise NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, Neo4j, etc
At least 5 years of specific expertise in data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data lakes, including data visualisation tools (e.g. D3.js, knowledge graphs, etc.)
At least 5 years of specific expertise in applied statistics, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc
A certification in AWS Certified Machine Learning, Microsoft Azure AI Engineer Associate, SAS Certified Professional AI or Machine Learning Certification will be considered a valuable asset


Languages


English
French


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator
