Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Greenomy is expanding, join a fast-growing company at the sweet spot between technology and sustainable finance!

At Greenomy, our mission is to accelerate the global transition to a sustainable economy. Our advanced SaaS regulatory reporting platform empowers companies to generate the data needed to comply swiftly and efficiently with the new tide of sustainability regulations at European and global levels. Our technology therefore facilitates the redirection of funds towards sustainable activities, speeding up the transition to a low carbon economy in line with the EU Green Deal.

In order to advance our product development, we are looking for a highly motivated medior or early career AI Engineer to join our team.

How You Will Make An Impact

As an AI Engineer you will be a critical part of our product development efforts. You are a pragmatic, hands-on problem solver who can turn AI and NLP research into real-world solutions to be integrated into our ESG reporting solutions. This role is all about building, deploying, and optimizing AI systems that deliver real impact. For this position we regret that we are unable to offer visa sponsorship but we are open to remote candidates who are based within a comparable timezone.

Your Team Will Work On


Build & Optimize AI Pipelines: Design, develop, and fine-tune AI pipelines, agents, and back-end services for data processing, analysis, and information extraction using deep learning frameworks and generative models.
Develop Practical AI Solutions: Move beyond theory to build functional generative AI and NLP systems that generate meaningful, contextually relevant text.
Data-Driven Implementation: Work with data engineers to preprocess and curate datasets for training, testing, and fine-tuning AI models, ensuring high-quality and reliable data.
Measure & Improve: Establish evaluation frameworks to assess AI pipeline performance and iterate efficiently based on results and user feedback.
Integrate AI into Products: Collaborate with software engineers, product managers, and domain experts to bring AI capabilities into production, ensuring they provide real business value.


What We Are Looking For


Entrepreneurial Mindset: Above all, we value a proactive, hands-on approach with a strong sense of ownership and problem-solving.
Education & Experience: Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field with a focus on NLP and AI‚Äîor equivalent practical experience.
Programming Expertise: Strong Python skills with deep knowledge of best practices, clean coding, and efficient implementations.
Practical AI Development: Proven ability to design and implement high-performance AI pipelines for data processing, analysis, and information extraction.
NLP Experience: 2+ years working with NLP techniques, solid understanding of NLP concepts, including tokenization, embeddings, semantic search and language modeling.
Generative AI Expertise: Hands-on experience with generative models and libraries like LangChain, LangGraph, and OpenAI APIs is highly desirable.
Data Handling & Model Training: Experience with large-scale dataset preprocessing, training, fine-tuning, and evaluation of AI models.
Problem-Solving & Innovation: Strong analytical thinking with the ability to develop creative solutions to complex challenges.
Communication Skills: Ability to effectively convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


It‚Äôs an advantage if you have any of the following:


Startup or Fast-Paced Tech Experience: Prior experience in a startup or dynamic tech environment where adaptability and problem-solving are key.
AI Product Development: Hands-on experience bringing AI-driven products to life, from concept to deployment.
Deep Learning Frameworks: Proficiency in PyTorch for building, training, and evaluating generative models (e.g., GPT, Transformers) is a strong plus.
Cloud & Infrastructure: Practical experience leveraging Azure services for machine learning, particularly Azure AI Foundry.
Kubernetes Knowledge: Familiarity with container orchestration and deployment in production environments.


What You Can Expect From Us


Compensation package tailored to your skills and experience.
A flexible and remote-friendly work environment.
Opportunity to build your core skills internally and via external trainings.
Regular team-building events.
A fast-growing company with a sense of purpose operating in a highly innovative space.
An entrepreneurial, international, and dynamic work environment.
A complementary team with a balanced skill and seniority mix that will support you and help you perform.
A strong recognition for your individual and collective contributions.
A highly caring team that embraces diversity


More About Greenomy And Our Values

Greenomy is a Brussels-based company founded in late 2020. Our partially remote team comprises passionate, diverse and complementary individuals from over 15 countries. We are fortunate to count on the trust and support of outstanding clients and strategic partners across Europe and beyond. We also have the backing of Euroclear, our first client who became our investor in February 2022. Our commitment to bringing innovative sustainability solutions to the market has been recognized on several occasions. Recent awards include ‚ÄúBest Sustainability Solution'' at the 2022 SIBOS in Amsterdam and first place at the 2021 G20 Techsprint for Sustainable Finance solutions in Milan.

We believe our ambition can only become a reality with a strong team spirit, drive for purpose, and eagerness to learn. We feel a responsibility to create a safe space for everyone. We bring diversity and inclusion are at the top of our agenda. Last but not least, as a sustainability company, we need to walk the talk!

We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity and strives to be a Great Place to Work for All. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of any aspect that makes them unique (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, pregnancy, disability).

HTML:
Greenomy is expanding, join a fast-growing company at the sweet spot between technology and sustainable finance!

At Greenomy, our mission is to accelerate the global transition to a sustainable economy. Our advanced SaaS regulatory reporting platform empowers companies to generate the data needed to comply swiftly and efficiently with the new tide of sustainability regulations at European and global levels. Our technology therefore facilitates the redirection of funds towards sustainable activities, speeding up the transition to a low carbon economy in line with the EU Green Deal.

In order to advance our product development, we are looking for a highly motivated medior or early career AI Engineer to join our team.

How You Will Make An Impact

As an AI Engineer you will be a critical part of our product development efforts. You are a pragmatic, hands-on problem solver who can turn AI and NLP research into real-world solutions to be integrated into our ESG reporting solutions. This role is all about building, deploying, and optimizing AI systems that deliver real impact. For this position we regret that we are unable to offer visa sponsorship but we are open to remote candidates who are based within a comparable timezone.

Your Team Will Work On

  • Build & Optimize AI Pipelines: Design, develop, and fine-tune AI pipelines, agents, and back-end services for data processing, analysis, and information extraction using deep learning frameworks and generative models.
  • Develop Practical AI Solutions: Move beyond theory to build functional generative AI and NLP systems that generate meaningful, contextually relevant text.
  • Data-Driven Implementation: Work with data engineers to preprocess and curate datasets for training, testing, and fine-tuning AI models, ensuring high-quality and reliable data.
  • Measure & Improve: Establish evaluation frameworks to assess AI pipeline performance and iterate efficiently based on results and user feedback.
  • Integrate AI into Products: Collaborate with software engineers, product managers, and domain experts to bring AI capabilities into production, ensuring they provide real business value.

What We Are Looking For

  • Entrepreneurial Mindset: Above all, we value a proactive, hands-on approach with a strong sense of ownership and problem-solving.
  • Education & Experience: Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field with a focus on NLP and AI‚Äîor equivalent practical experience.
  • Programming Expertise: Strong Python skills with deep knowledge of best practices, clean coding, and efficient implementations.
  • Practical AI Development: Proven ability to design and implement high-performance AI pipelines for data processing, analysis, and information extraction.
  • NLP Experience: 2+ years working with NLP techniques, solid understanding of NLP concepts, including tokenization, embeddings, semantic search and language modeling.
  • Generative AI Expertise: Hands-on experience with generative models and libraries like LangChain, LangGraph, and OpenAI APIs is highly desirable.
  • Data Handling & Model Training: Experience with large-scale dataset preprocessing, training, fine-tuning, and evaluation of AI models.
  • Problem-Solving & Innovation: Strong analytical thinking with the ability to develop creative solutions to complex challenges.
  • Communication Skills: Ability to effectively convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

It‚Äôs an advantage if you have any of the following:

  • Startup or Fast-Paced Tech Experience: Prior experience in a startup or dynamic tech environment where adaptability and problem-solving are key.
  • AI Product Development: Hands-on experience bringing AI-driven products to life, from concept to deployment.
  • Deep Learning Frameworks: Proficiency in PyTorch for building, training, and evaluating generative models (e.g., GPT, Transformers) is a strong plus.
  • Cloud & Infrastructure: Practical experience leveraging Azure services for machine learning, particularly Azure AI Foundry.
  • Kubernetes Knowledge: Familiarity with container orchestration and deployment in production environments.

What You Can Expect From Us

  • Compensation package tailored to your skills and experience.
  • A flexible and remote-friendly work environment.
  • Opportunity to build your core skills internally and via external trainings.
  • Regular team-building events.
  • A fast-growing company with a sense of purpose operating in a highly innovative space.
  • An entrepreneurial, international, and dynamic work environment.
  • A complementary team with a balanced skill and seniority mix that will support you and help you perform.
  • A strong recognition for your individual and collective contributions.
  • A highly caring team that embraces diversity

More About Greenomy And Our Values

Greenomy is a Brussels-based company founded in late 2020. Our partially remote team comprises passionate, diverse and complementary individuals from over 15 countries. We are fortunate to count on the trust and support of outstanding clients and strategic partners across Europe and beyond. We also have the backing of Euroclear, our first client who became our investor in February 2022. Our commitment to bringing innovative sustainability solutions to the market has been recognized on several occasions. Recent awards include ‚ÄúBest Sustainability Solution'' at the 2022 SIBOS in Amsterdam and first place at the 2021 G20 Techsprint for Sustainable Finance solutions in Milan.

We believe our ambition can only become a reality with a strong team spirit, drive for purpose, and eagerness to learn. We feel a responsibility to create a safe space for everyone. We bring diversity and inclusion are at the top of our agenda. Last but not least, as a sustainability company, we need to walk the talk!

We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity and strives to be a Great Place to Work for All. Title: Data Scientist
Company: Nuit√©e | Enabling all companies to build travel solutions
Description:
About the company

Founded in 2017, Nuit√©e makes it easy for businesses to build travel applications securely and quickly, accelerating your revenue growth. We're committed to enhancing the travel planning process and ensuring our technology meets the dynamic needs of our users.

Nuitee is headquartered in Ireland with a tech and operations hub in Casablanca, Morocco and Palma de Mallorca, Spain. Commercial staff are based around the world in the USA, Mexico, Spain, Germany and Argentina.




About the Role:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, data analysis, and reporting, with experience in travel tech or related domains. You will work on cutting-edge projects involving search optimization, NLP systems, and various machine learning models.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models using XGBoost and other classical ML algorithms
Design and maintain data pipelines using Metaflow for efficient model training and deployment
Conduct in-depth data analysis and create comprehensive reports using BigQuery
Contribute to the development of NLP systems and language models
Optimize search algorithms and recommendation systems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve complex business problems
Stay current with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning




Our Ideal Candidate:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
2-4 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL
Extensive experience with data analysis and visualization tools
Proven track record of developing and deploying machine learning models in production environments
Experience with XGBoost and other classical machine learning algorithms
Familiarity with BigQuery for large-scale data analysis and reporting
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to present complex findings to non-technical stakeholders




Nice to have:

Experience in the travel tech industry
Hands-on experience with Metaflow for managing data science workflows
Knowledge of NLP techniques and language models
Experience with search optimization and recommendation systems
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure)
Contributions to open-source projects or research publications in relevant fields







Why Nuitee?

At Nuitee, you‚Äôll be part of an innovative team that thrives on pushing boundaries and defining the future of travel technology. We offer the flexibility of remote work and the opportunity to make significant impacts on a global scale, enhancing the travel experiences for millions of users. Join us and help drive the continuous evolution of our cutting-edge platform.




Be part of a company on the way to becoming the world's leading technology platform for travel.

We're seeking individuals who are eager to embark on this exhilarating journey. Grab the chance to join us and send your application today!

Title: Data Scientist / AI Engineer
Description:
Job Description




My client are at the forefront of technology, specializing in AI-driven solutions within a rapidly evolving industry. Their mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI, especially in sectors where precision and quality are paramount. We are looking for a visionary leader to join their team and drive cutting-edge projects that will shape the future.




They building a next-generation data platform, powered by Databricks on Azure, to support all our data initiatives. The goal is to transition toward a data mesh architecture that offers scalability, flexibility, and seamless access across teams. We believe that fostering collaboration and innovation creates a data-driven culture that empowers everyone to make informed decisions.




What You'll Do

Design and manage our data infrastructure on Databricks and Azure to ensure it is scalable and high-performing.
Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to create a platform that aligns with various team needs.
Contribute to platform architecture using data mesh principles to enable decentralized data ownership.
Ensure the platform meets security and performance standards, and implement innovative best practices.
Collaborate with other teams to support end-to-end data integration and workflows for multiple data products.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in data platform technology and engineering.

Your Background

3-5 years of experience in data engineering, ideally within a data and analytics setting.
A Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a similar field.
Strong expertise in Azure and Databricks, including infrastructure as code, data lake storage, and ETL processes.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for innovation.
Familiarity with data mesh concepts and experience working within decentralized data architectures.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a drive to work with cross-functional teams.

What We Offer

We‚Äôre committed to creating a supportive, inclusive environment that values personal growth and work-life balance. Here‚Äôs what we offer:

An international, diverse workspace with professionals from various fields.
A culture that emphasizes respect, collaboration, and continuous learning.
An extensive onboarding program, with mentorship to help you grow.
Competitive salary, comprehensive health coverage, paid leave, retirement benefits, and flexible work arrangements.

Title: Data Scientist (SN0366)
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to oversee the entire lifecycle of data projects, from design to operational implementation.


The ideal candidate will have expertise in developing and deploying AI models, including generative AI, predictive modeling, classification, and clustering.
You will be responsible for designing optimized data processing pipelines, analyzing business needs, and collaborating with stakeholders to translate requirements into technical solutions.


Key Responsibilities


Manage end-to-end data projects, from design to deployment.
Develop and implement advanced AI models, including generative and traditional machine learning techniques (prediction, classification, clustering).
Design and optimize data processing pipelines using Python on the Dataiku platform.
Analyze business needs and convert them into technical specifications.
Organize and lead workshops with stakeholders to understand expectations and priorities.
Collect, analyze, and process large volumes of data to drive insights.
Develop APIs on Dataiku to integrate AI solutions effectively.
Conduct extensive testing and validation to ensure model robustness and accuracy.
Write detailed technical and functional documentation for project transparency and reusability.
Present project summaries, recommendations, and progress updates to stakeholders.
Promote data and AI culture within the organization.


Required Skills & Qualifications


5+ years of experience managing data science projects, including AI-driven applications.
PRINCE2, Agile, or PPM methodologies.
Python, SQL, and data frameworks
Dataiku for data processing and AI model development.
Big Data and working with large-scale datasets.
Strong communication, teamwork, problem-solving, and analytical skills.


Languages


French
English
Luxembourgish
German

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged ‚Äì to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production ‚Äì and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders ‚Äì clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,‚Ä¶


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,‚Ä¶
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE‚Äôs, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD‚Äôs, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,‚Ä¶) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data/Pre-Training)
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (LLM Data/Pre-Training)

Europe (remote)

‚Ç¨200-300k base salary + equity




About Us

We‚Äôre a fast-growing, well-funded startup currently training a foundational LLM. Our mission is to build cutting-edge Large Language Models (LLMs) that empower businesses and developers to solve real-world problems. We‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who is excited about designing robust data pipelines, scaling transformer-based models, and leveraging synthetic data techniques to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in NLP.




What You‚Äôll Do

Design & Build Data Pipelines: Own the end-to-end process of gathering, cleaning, and curating massive text datasets‚Äîincluding real-world and synthetic data‚Äîto fuel LLM pre-training.
Train Large-Scale Models: Implement and optimize large language model training on GPU/TPU clusters.
Leverage Synthetic Data Generation: Explore and develop methods for data augmentation or synthetic text generation to address low-resource domains, bias mitigation, and overall dataset enrichment.
Optimize Performance: Develop strategies for efficient distributed training, memory optimization, and large-scale deployment.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with research scientists, data engineers, and software engineers to deploy, evaluate, and iterate on LLMs.
Experiment & Innovate: Stay at the cutting edge of NLP by testing new architectures, fine-tuning techniques, and data augmentation strategies.




Who You Are

Technical Expert: You have experience with transformer-based models and have built or contributed to large-scale NLP systems.
Data Savvy: Proficient in data wrangling at scale, including experience with Spark, Ray, or similar distributed frameworks.
Synthetic Data Enthusiast: You‚Äôve experimented with synthetic or augmented data to improve model performance and address data scarcity or bias.
ML Tooling Pro: Skilled in PyTorch and/or TensorFlow, with exposure to libraries like Hugging Face Transformers or Megatron-LM.
Performance Oriented: Able to optimize training pipelines for performance, leveraging GPU/TPU-based clusters.
Problem Solver: You thrive in a dynamic startup environment where creativity, autonomy, and rapid iteration are essential.
Team Player: Strong communication and collaboration skills. You enjoy sharing ideas, mentoring, and driving results together.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
afarax is looking for a freelance Machine Learning Engineer. We need you!




The project:

Our client in the banking sector is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team.




Tasks:

Manage the execution and quality assurance of the monthly production run from data preparation, scoring and validation of different AI models and analytical indicators. Improve the automation of this process to make it more efficient
Maintain and improve the existing python programs for collecting and validating data from different sources, for building, scoring, and performance monitoring of AI models of the team (e.g. python version upgrades)
Interface between data scientists and IT to support the usage of the Domino Data Science Platform, the AI building blocks and the evolution of the python environment.
Assist data scientist by helping them identify and install the correct dependencies in their environment, best practices for code quality, continuous improvement and automation
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering), automatic refit of the data science models
Explore new ways of combining the available tools of the bank (AI building blocks from Tribe AI) to unlock new capabilities for building AI products and supporting the data scientists.
Work with a team of motivated data scientists who are eager to learn, collaborate and share expertise




Is this you?

You have a fluent knowledge of English (spoken and written)
Fluent/Good level of Dutch (French is a plus)
You have a degree in a quantitative field (e.g Master in computer sciences)
Strong expertise in software development in Python and Python data science packages (pandas, sklearn)
Git
bash

SAS
Domino Data Science Platform
Django

Our client in the banking sector is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

Who We Are

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.

In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

What You‚Äôll Do


You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists
You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning
You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).


About You


You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.
You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
You have fully professional proficiency in English


Travel: 0%

Start date: ASAP

Our offer

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What‚Äôs important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE‚Äôs hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.

N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.

Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant‚Äôs personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Freelance AI Engineer (Financial Sector) ‚Äì Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are looking for a skilled Freelance AI Engineer to work closely with our data team and drive AI-powered innovations in the financial sector. Based in Brussels, this 12-month contract involves collaborating with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI models for fraud detection, risk assessment, and automated financial decision-making.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the data team (data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers) to build and deploy AI-driven financial solutions.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning and deep learning models for risk management, fraud detection, algorithmic trading, and credit scoring.
Optimize AI models for real-time financial applications while ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Work with big data platforms to process large-scale structured and unstructured financial datasets.
Develop and maintain end-to-end AI pipelines, including data ingestion, model training, and deployment.
Deploy AI models using MLOps best practices (CI/CD, model monitoring, and retraining).
Ensure AI solutions comply with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Work with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for scalable AI deployment.
Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve financial analytics and decision-making.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or C++ for AI/ML development.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Hands-on experience in AI model deployment using Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases for working with financial data.
Familiarity with big data processing technologies (Apache Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Experience in cloud computing (AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).
Solid understanding of MLOps tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow).

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical mindset.
Ability to collaborate effectively with data scientists, analysts, and engineers.
Excellent communication skills to explain AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented, with a focus on model accuracy and ethical AI considerations.

Preferred Experience

Prior experience in the financial sector (banking, fintech, insurance).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II) as they relate to AI.
Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT), robo-advisors, or automated financial systems is a plus.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid ‚Äì On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or directly email me at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
To reinforce our Benelux Data Office department, Allianz is currently looking for a Data Scientist. Are you looking for a role where you can be at the forefront of using cutting-edge data analytics techniques to drive strategic decisions and provide innovative solutions for business challenges? Join us at Allianz and be part of our dynamic team that leverages data science to drive innovation and make a meaningful impact in the insurance sector!




As a Data Scientist at Allianz, you will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions to support decision-making systems at Allianz. You will engage with business functions to develop ideas, proof of concept to support a transformation business case and release your models to cloud-based state of the art production platform together with IT, senior engineers and scientists. You will analyze information from various data sources using statistics, including machine learning, to provide insights on various business problems. You will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions (incl. GenAI) to support decision-making systems at Allianz.




What do you get in return?




We offer you a full-time challenging role in an international landscape based in Brussels or Rotterdam;
Working in a dynamic environment at Allianz, world leader in insurances;
You will work from our new office, from walkable distance from Brussel-North or Rotterdam Central station;
A pleasant working atmosphere within an experienced and enthusiastic team;
Development opportunities and a nice salary package supplemented with fringe benefits.




As Data Scientist, your main responsibilities will be:




Model Development and Integration: Build, implement, and continuously enhance machine learning and statistical models using cutting-edge tools. Focus on integrating these models into our IT infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. Collaborate with IT and DevOps teams to deploy models in production environments, monitor their performance, and optimize for efficiency. Translate business problems into robust data-driven solutions while maintaining best practices in version control, testing, and documentation.
Collaborate with Stakeholders: Partner with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and convert them into actionable data science projects, ensuring that the solutions align with business objectives.
Data Management and Analysis: Acquire, clean, and integrate data from various sources to address business issues. Use advanced data analytics techniques to manipulate and interpret complex datasets, providing clear insights and answers to critical business questions.
Knowledge and Trend Analysis: Stay informed about the latest industry trends to maintain a competitive edge and apply this knowledge to drive strategic decisions and methodologies within the company.




Let‚Äôs do the match?




You have a Bachelors/Masters degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics, Physics, Actuarial, Statistics, or Mathematics? Check! Knowledge of machine learning principles and unsupervised machine learning techniques, including linear models and tree-based methods for regression and classification? Check! Ability to easily interpret common performance metrics? Check! Advanced skills in Python or R, proficiency in SQL and good knowledge of cloud data environments (e.g., Microsoft Azure)? Double check!




Have we peaked your interest? Join us and #LetsCareForTomorrow




Allianz is an equal opportunity employer and therefore welcomes applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We‚Äôre seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our analytics team, driving performance optimization and providing strategic insights. You will be responsible for developing and refining LTV, ROAS prediction models, and working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data to enhance user acquisition and marketing efficiency. This is a hands-on role where you‚Äôll also lead the development of foundational marketing analytics systems.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You'll be working on hands-on development and refinement of LTV and ROAS predictive models to optimize marketing spend.
You'll maintain and improve SKAN ETL pipelines, ensuring accurate collection and analysis of post-install metrics to inform marketing strategy .
You'll analyze marketing KPIs like CAC, CTR, ROAS, and conversion rates, delivering actionable insights to drive campaign performance.
You'll collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, and data engineering teams to identify data needs and strategies .
You'll design and implement A/B tests for user acquisition campaigns, measuring impact and optimizing channels.
You'll create dashboards and reports to visualize marketing performance and trends, communicating insights to non-technical stakeholders .
You'll proactively drive the evolution of marketing analytics by identifying data-driven opportunities and building foundational analytics processes.


What You'll Bring To The Team


2-3+ years of experience in marketing data science or analytics (preferably in mobile gaming or apps).
Proficiency in SQL, Python (or R), with a strong background in building and deploying LTV/ROAS prediction models.
Experience working with SKAN and marketing attribution tools .
Strong understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC, ROAS, LTV, and engagement metrics.
Experience in machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification) for building predictive models.
Experience in A/B testing and statistical analysis.
Proven ability to work independently and drive projects autonomously in a fast-paced environment .
Familiarity with BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Title: AI ML Engineer
Company: Bridebook - The No.1 Wedding Planning App
Description:
At Bridebook, we're digitising the wedding industry! Join us in transforming the wedding planning experience for engaged couples around the world.




Who is Bridebook anyway? üíô




Bridebook is a revolutionary wedding planning platform that seeks to make wedding planning an enjoyable, intuitive, and rewarding experience for couples, guests, and industry partners. Launched in the UK, Bridebook has over 1,000,000 planning couples and has been featured in major outlets such as the New York Times, the BBC, and the App Store. After six years and many iterations later, we have 2 in 3 engaged UK couples and 1 in 3 engaged German couples using Bridebook, and have recently expanded globally. While we serve a very emotional and creative industry, we are obsessed with using tech and data to revolutionise the industry. We have a team of motivated and experienced professionals with ambitious plans to make Bridebook an iconic global brand, making this an exciting time to join our vibrant and innovative company.




What will I be doing? ‚Äç‚Äçüë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª




Join us in revolutionizing the wedding planning experience with AI-powered solutions! We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on AI Engineer to build, optimize, and deploy cutting-edge AI applications that enhance our platform‚Äôs intelligence.




Specific responsibilities will include:




AI Application Development ‚Äì Design and implement AI-driven features using LLMs, RAG systems, and AI agents.
Search & Recommendations ‚Äì Build smart search and retrieval systems with Elasticsearch and vector search.
Model Engineering ‚Äì Optimize prompt engineering, fine-tune models, and enhance inference efficiency.
AI Infrastructure & MLOps ‚Äì Architect and scale AI pipelines, ensuring robust monitoring, security, and deployment.
Full-Stack Development ‚Äì Work with TypeScript, React, and Node.js to integrate AI seamlessly.







We‚Äôre looking for someone with: üß†üíö




AI/ML Expertise ‚Äì Experience with LLMs, RAG, prompt engineering, and AI agent development.
Software Engineering Skills ‚Äì Strong coding background in Python & TypeScript, with experience in cloud-based AI solutions.
Infrastructure & MLOps ‚Äì Proficiency in GCP, Vercel, containerization, and monitoring AI applications
Scalability & Performance Focus ‚Äì Ability to design efficient AI systems that are cost-effective and production-ready.
AI Safety & Responsible AI ‚Äì Strong understanding of AI ethics, safety guardrails, and monitoring best practices.




What if you‚Äôre a partial fit?üå±




We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the wedding industry and welcome candidates with different backgrounds and experiences! We prioritise grit, positivity, and the willingness to get stuck in, and encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn‚Äôt exactly match this job description.

Our Values üôå

Bridebook is a revolutionary wedding planning platform that seeks to make wedding planning an enjoyable, intuitive, and rewarding experience for couples, guests, and industry partners. Launched in the UK, Bridebook has over 1,000,000 planning couples and has been featured in major outlets such as the New York Times, the BBC, and the App Store. After six years and many iterations later, we have 2 in 3 engaged UK couples and 1 in 3 engaged German couples using Bridebook, and have recently expanded globally. Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to work in a company with the purpose of helping patients around the world? Do you want to learn and grow every day? Do you want to change healthcare?




Lyfegen is a fast-growing health-tech company making healthcare more accessible and affordable by delivering solutions for healthcare payers and pharma to identify the right drug pricing agreements, simulate and understand the financial impacts of those agreements, and automate the management of them.




We are seeking a passionate and skilled AI Engineer. This role focuses on leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology.




We are doing things nobody has done before! Thus, creative problem solving is a must and a get-things-done mentality a definitive requirement.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.
Familiarity with databases for storing and retrieving data for AI models. (SQLAlchemy,Alembic)
Expertise in Python-based Web frameworks such as Flask, Django or FastAPI.
Research mindset by owning an AI feature/product end to end building server-side software that delivers AI inference results, aiming for reliable, scalable systems that seamlessly integrate into our products.
AI toolchain integration skills. Ability to integrate and orchestrate AI tools and libraries into cohesive, user-friendly, and performant systems.
Experience in recommendation engines is a bonus, particularly in apps involving pricing.
Strong problem-solving abilities to identify issues and evaluate solutions.
Analytical skills to implement effective AI strategies.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively with stakeholders.
Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly AI-enabled solutions.
Hands-on experience with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) on tabular data.







What we offer:

Join a company with a purposeful vision and mission.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ITMAGINATION helps its Clients by becoming a true extension of their software and data development capabilities. Through the readily set up, comprehensive, and self-governing teams, we let our Clients focus on their business while we make sure that their software products and data tools scale up accordingly and with outstanding quality.

We are looking for experienced team players to fill the Data Scientist position and participate in our up-and-coming project for our client from the pharmaceutical industry.

You can expect:


working with highly skilled team of professionals
leveraging advanced algorithms, and high-performance computing


Requirements


Min. 3 years of industry experience in Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics, or a related quantitative field
Experience in digital health, physiological signal processing, and bioinformatics
Proficiency in Python
Strong background in machine learning, deep learning, statistical analysis, especially for large datasets
Familiarity with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP, Snowflake)
Excellent communication skills for collaborating and presenting technical concepts
Excellent English skills


Nice to have:


Programming experience in R or MATLAB
Knowledge of GPU computing, high-performance computing, and cloud-native applications
Familiarity with cardiovascular, neuroscience, or epidemiology data


Benefits


Fully remote work model
Professional training programs ‚Äì including Udemy and other development plans
Benefits package offer - Health Insurance, Sports Package, and Life Insurance offerings
Work with a team that‚Äôs recognized for its excellence. We‚Äôve been featured in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 & FT 1000 rankings. We‚Äôve also received the Great Place To Work¬Æ certification for five years in a row

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer ‚Äì AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years‚Äô experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
üöÄ Join Movify ‚Äì Where elevation starts with a vision!

At Movify, we don‚Äôt just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




ü§ñ What you‚Äôll be doing

‚Ä¢ Identify, analyze, and translate business challenges into AI-driven solutions

‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and implement machine learning models and data-driven insights

‚Ä¢ Work with stakeholders to define AI use cases and align them with business objectives

‚Ä¢ Collect, clean, and preprocess data for analysis and modeling

‚Ä¢ Evaluate and optimize AI models for performance, scalability, and business impact

‚Ä¢ Communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences

‚Ä¢ Ensure ethical AI practices, data governance, and compliance with industry standards

‚Ä¢ Stay up to date with the latest trends in AI, data science, and machine learning

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and business analysts




üß† Skills & qualifications

‚Ä¢ 2 to 4 years of experience in AI, data science, or analytics

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of machine learning, data analysis, and statistical modeling

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)

‚Ä¢ Ability to bridge the gap between technical and business needs

‚Ä¢ Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib)

‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to work autonomously

‚Ä¢ Flexibility to adapt to new challenges and environments

‚Ä¢ Fluent in FR or NL + strong command of English

‚Ä¢ A team-player attitude and a good sense of humor üòä




üí° What Movify offers

‚Ä¢ Structured training in AI, data science, and emerging technologies

‚Ä¢ An agile and fast-paced environment

‚Ä¢ A culture of empowerment, openness, and autonomy

‚Ä¢ Room for personal and professional development

‚Ä¢ A competitive package

‚Ä¢ A passionate and supportive team

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Engineer(SAN307)
Description:
Job Description


We are looking for a talented and motivated Natural Language Processing (NLP) Engineer to join our team.
The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of NLP techniques and algorithms, with a focus on building and deploying scalable NLP solutions to process, analyze, and generate text data.
As an NLP Engineer, you will work with cross-functional teams to integrate advanced NLP models into applications, helping to deliver cutting-edge solutions in areas such as machine translation, text summarization, sentiment analysis, and more. Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement NLP models and algorithms for various use cases (e.g., text classification, named entity recognition, machine translation, sentiment analysis).
Preprocess and clean large datasets, including tokenization, lemmatization, and stopword removal.
Develop, test, and optimize NLP pipelines for deployment at scale in production environments.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate NLP solutions into broader systems and applications.
Stay up-to-date with the latest NLP research and trends, incorporating state-of-the-art techniques into our solutions. Technical Skills:
Python
Java
NLTK
PyTorch
LSTMs
Pandas
SQL
Git

Title: Research Scientist (Jr)
Description:
Position: Jr. Research Scientist

Location: Brussels/Leuven, Belgium




Role Overview

We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.




Your Responsibilities

Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
Validate (numerically/experimentally) solutions using real-life datasets.
Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.




Required Skills

Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.
Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).




Soft Skills

Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.




Application Requirements

CV highlighting:
Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) ‚Äìnote: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

Show more
HTML:
Position: Jr. Research Scientist

Location: Brussels/Leuven, Belgium


Role Overview

We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.


Your Responsibilities

  • Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
  • Validate (numerically/experimentally) solutions using real-life datasets.
  • Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.


Required Skills

  • Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.
  • Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
  • Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
  • Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).


Soft Skills

  • Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.


Application Requirements

  • CV highlighting:
  • Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
  • Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) ‚Äìnote: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
  • Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer - Remote - Up to $50K




I‚Äôm partnered with an innovative startup that‚Äôs building AI-driven solutions for the Financial Services sector, currently focused on delivering a groundbreaking product set to launch later this year. They‚Äôre building cutting-edge tools to solve complex problems in the world of qualitative equity research, and they need an AI Engineer to help make it happen.




We‚Äôre looking for someone with:




1-2 years of experience in AI/ML development.

If you‚Äôre passionate about AI and excited to make an impact, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Apply now.

Title: AI /NLP/ ML Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI /NLP/ ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either on the company's premises or on site at the customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Integration and maintenance of software applications or services in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in different technologies such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), Information Extraction, Knowledge Graphs (KG) or Graph Data Science (GDS);
  • Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data;
  • Prompt engineering on Large Language Models and validation of results with the business/policy officers;
  • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques;
  • Œônteracting with policy officers, data stewards and other stakeholders to understand business and data needs, turn them into use cases, prototypes or statements of work and eventually support the solution acceptance process;
  • Defining data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality, integrity and Performance;
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods;
  • Designing the IT architecture and hosting solutions and coordinate its implementation considering cloud technologies, containers, DevOps, master- and metadata management concepts and security;
  • Contributing to the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and deriving the IT requirements.


Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in Perl, Python, Matlab, R and their NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas);
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in Large Language Model prompt engineering.;
  • At least 7 years of specific expertise in query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc and with information extraction;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in data management and analytics, including data quality, and advanced data retrieval tools;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in AWS, Azure or other cloud platforms;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in machine learning systems lifecycle;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise software development methodologies such as Agile or RUP;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, Neo4j, etc;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data lakes, including data visualisation tools (e.g. D3.js, knowledge graphs, etc.);
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in applied statistics, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc;
  • A certification in AWS Certified Machine Learning, Microsoft Azure AI Engineer Associate, SAS Certified Professional AI or Machine Learning Certification will be considered a valuable asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language and French language will be considered an asset.


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18196/02/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.


EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Software Engineer (AI / ML)
Description:
Hey! Thanks for taking the time to read through one of our open roles. We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Software Engineer (AI/ML) to join our Research & Development team and we hope this could be a match made in heaven.




Who is Peppy?

Our mission is to fix healthcare & wellbeing. We do this by supporting the employees of our global clients, including JP Morgan, Disney, Meta, Nvidia, Microsoft, Sony, Clifford Chance, Wells Fargo, Bloomberg, and over 200 others.




Having already revolutionised the employee benefits sector with our innovative clinical products ‚Äì such as the world‚Äôs first menopause benefit ‚Äì we are now building the world‚Äôs most advanced benefits management platform. Think of us as a ‚ÄúDeel for Benefits‚Äù ‚Äì a rocket-ship opportunity with a mission that truly matters. The global benefits sector encompasses employer-funded pensions, critical illness insurance, private healthcare insurance, and many other categories. This is a trillion-dollar TAM with weak, incumbent competition and almost no AI-first startups stepping up to the challenge.




We are a Series B company with $56m in funding to date, operationally cashflow positive, and with secure access to additional capital for accelerated growth. Join us for the ride of your life.




What will a day in the life of our Software Engineer (AI/ML) look like?

Build AI-first features end-to-end: You‚Äôll contribute to the design, deployment, and iteration of our next-generation benefits platform features that leverage personalization, experimentation, and AI/ML methods (e.g. agents/LLMs, recommender systems, reinforcement learning) to enhance user experience in a meaningful business domain.
Stay versatile across the stack: You‚Äôll work in React (JavaScript/TypeScript) on the frontend and Python on the backend, shipping production-ready code and user-facing features in addition to innovative ML work.
Engage in data pipelines & ML workflows: From data ingestion and feature engineering to model deployment and monitoring, you‚Äôll help shape how we deliver advanced personalization and recommendations to our users.
Keep code clean and well-tested: Maintain clean, efficient, and tested code with clear documentation for both peers and future reference.
Participate in agile, cross-functional teams: Collaborate closely with design, product, and beyond to deliver impactful user and business outcomes, bringing a user-focused perspective to the development process.
Review, refine, and grow: Actively participate in peer reviews, CI/CD processes, and a growth-minded engineering culture, where you continuously seek to level up your technical skills.
Be a team player: Sometimes you‚Äôll be iterating on ML pipelines; other times you‚Äôll be refining a frontend component or fixing a tricky bug. We need someone who‚Äôs excited about the full product journey and moving together as one.
Broaden your impact: Gain a deeper understanding of how engineering efforts support various business functions (clinical ops, service delivery, sales, marketing) and seek opportunities to enhance user satisfaction and operational efficiency.




Our dream Software Engineer (AI/ML) will have:

Academic/Applied ML Background: A solid foundation in machine learning‚Äîparticularly in recommender systems and personalization‚Äîgained through an advanced degree (MSc or higher) or equivalent practical experience.
Industry Experience (3+ years): Prior experience contributing to impactful products in fast-paced or startup environments, with an understanding of both scale and quality from larger tech organizations.
Hands-On Full Stack Skills: Proficiency in React/Typescript and Python (RESTful APIs, data pipelines), plus comfort with deploying and maintaining services on modern cloud platforms (GCP preferred, AWS or Azure also fine).
Recommender Systems & Personalization Know-How: Familiarity with data engineering, collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, or other ML-driven personalization strategies‚Äîand eagerness to deepen this knowledge.
Team-Oriented Mindset: Strong communication skills for explaining complex ideas to technical and non-technical audiences, and a passion for collaborating within cross-functional teams.
A Desire to Ship: Motivation to see your projects‚ÄîML or otherwise‚Äîget shipped to production and tested with real users, and to continually improve them based on feedback.
Strong Coding Practices & Curiosity: A commitment to writing efficient, scalable, and maintainable code, along with a willingness to learn new technologies, investigate emerging trends, and build quick prototypes.




You may not check all of these boxes, and that‚Äôs totally fine! We strongly encourage excited candidates of all backgrounds to apply.




Still looking for more intel? Here‚Äôs some other really cool things about Peppy which might be helpful:

We raised a $45mil Series B fundraise January 2023, led by Albion VC
We‚Äôre one of Europe‚Äôs fastest growing HealthTech scale-ups
We are remote-first, headquartered in the UK with 100+ employees across the UK, USA and Europe
We're proudly B-corp certified and mission-led
We are rated one of the Top Startups to work for by LinkedIn, Sifted, Tempo and Flexa




Much like us, we know you‚Äôre into perks and benefits, so here‚Äôs a list of ours:

Access to Peppy: You can receive free unlimited access to the Peppy app to use our Menopause, Fertility, Baby, Women‚Äôs Health or Men‚Äôs Health services
Health & Wellbeing: You will receive Private Medical Insurance through Vitality, including VitalityGP, optical, dental and hearing coverage
Financial Wellness: You have access to your own confidential financial wellbeing coach and resources, through Bippit
Parental Leave: We have a generous Enhanced Family Leave policy, whether you or your partner are giving birth, going through surrogacy or adoption
Pension: We offer an up to 5% employer pension contribution scheme through Cushon
Holidays: Peppy employees in the UK get 25 days holiday per year, plus bank holidays
Remote-First: We're a remote-first business, rather than remote-only. This person can be based remotely from anywhere in Europe
Socials: We encourage our employees to join our in-person team events and socials to build stronger connections within your team. If you live outside London, your travel expenses for these events are on us too!
Tech: New joiners receive a company MacBook delivered in time for your first day




Package on offer for our Software Engineer (AI/ML):

Salary of ¬£90,000 to ¬£110,000/annum dependent on your experience
Stock options grant to enable you to share in our future collective success




Equality & Diversity:

Peppy's mission is to help people in life's most challenging journeys. We pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to equality and diversity amongst both our employees and prospective applicants. We ensure that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process.
