Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
üéâ Join the Future of Fun! Become a Machine Learning Engineer in the iGaming Industry! üéâ

Are you a tech wizard with a passion for working with cool tech? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! We‚Äôre on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team in the thrilling world of iGaming. As a key player in our innovative team, you‚Äôll be diving into the latest ML algorithms, crafting intelligent systems that enhance customer experience, and pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in the iGaming universe.




This role requires you to have the right to work in Europe no work visa on offer




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Design, develop and maintain ML pipelines, ensuring high reliability and scalability.
Implement scalable machine learning infrastructure, to deploy advanced algorithms based on image, text, audio and tabular data.
Optimize trained AI models (latency, memory, throughput, ...)
Develop CI/CD pipelines and containerize production applications
Automate existing workflows withing Data Science team
Monitor and troubleshoot production ML systems to ensure smooth operation using alert systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across data and engineering to come up with solutions to complex problem statements.
Lead research initiatives to explore new methodologies, tools, and technologies, and contribute to the development of best ML OPs practices within the company.







REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Python, with extensive experience in PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Extensive knowledge of key machine learning metrics and optimization techniques.
Strong knowledge of version control systems (Git, data versioning, ...).
Experience in model management and experiment tracking frameworks
Strong knowledge and practical understanding of different ML Ops techniques.
Prior experience in handling very large datasets across different business functions.
Practical experience of deploying and monitoring scalable machine learning models in real-world applications.
Prior experience in CI/CD pipelines, containerization, scheduling and automation.
Prior experience in designing production ready and large-scale AI/ML systems end-to-end in a very fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Self-motivated individual who can work independently, and stay updated on updated with the latest advancements in AI, deep learning, generative AI and related system design areas.







PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:




Extensive experience with Azure ecosystem, in particular Azure Machine Learning.
Experience developing computer vision, text, audio, and/or tabular data models.
Strong proficiency in Gitlab CI, Jenkins, Grafana, Docker.
Excellent software engineering skills in API design and development, and concurrency design skills.




If you are a skilled Machine Learning Enginner who has passion to work in a fast-paced environment, have an eye for details and ready to experiment new things, we encourage you to apply and be part of our dynamic and innovative team and organization.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

DeepRec.ai is collaborating with a rapidly growing, innovative entertainment company.




Their Machine Learning R&D team designs, creates & uses state-of-the-art solutions to solve problems in live streaming apps. They apply AI where it is beneficial and profitable, thus not limiting temselves to a single topic in the AI world.




For the client, it's always important to work with as motivated and passionate people.

If you are looking for real-life challenges, join them to build an independent ML system together.




Design, build, train and test Machine Learning models which can learn and respond to complex situations
Brainstorm solutions to the toughest problems alongside a team of smart, creative, passionate engineers and scientists
Write production-level code to convert your ML models into working pipelines that are used every day
Work closely with Data Scientists, other Machine Learning Engineers, and Scientists to create, train, evaluate and deploy models
Optimize model and code to perform at scale
Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and distribute knowledge




Qualifications

5+ years of industry or research experience developing Machine Learning models
Fluency in Python and experience with commonly used data science packages
Interest in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Audio Processing projects
Deep knowledge of ML libraries like Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
Excellent understanding of classical and deep machine learning techniques and algorithms
Experience with common statistics methodologies (distributions, clustering, regression, forecasting, classification, regularization, resampling)
"Engineer at heart" with a high degree of comfort in designing software systems and producing high-quality code
Great communication and collaboration skills

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerci√´le B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat Betekent


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je Herkent Jezelf In De Volgende Competenties


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe idee√´n helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerci√´le strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast Kan Je Rekenen Op


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en priv√© dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in Belgi√´, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega‚Äôs.

What‚Äôs next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French
Show more
HTML:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.


For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.


Our big success so far:

  • A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
  • International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
  • Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up


As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !


What will be your tasks with us ?


You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.


You will be working in the following areas:

  • Business case study with business teams
  • Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
  • Elaboration of Data Science solutions
  • Going into production with Data Engineers
  • Creation of POC, model development
  • Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations


Who are you ?

  • You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
  • You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
  • You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
  • You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
  • You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
  • You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
  • Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
  • Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Engineer(SAN307)
Description:
Job Description


We are looking for a talented and motivated Natural Language Processing (NLP) Engineer to join our team.
The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of NLP techniques and algorithms, with a focus on building and deploying scalable NLP solutions to process, analyze, and generate text data.
As an NLP Engineer, you will work with cross-functional teams to integrate advanced NLP models into applications, helping to deliver cutting-edge solutions in areas such as machine translation, text summarization, sentiment analysis, and more. Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement NLP models and algorithms for various use cases (e.g., text classification, named entity recognition, machine translation, sentiment analysis).
Preprocess and clean large datasets, including tokenization, lemmatization, and stopword removal.
Develop, test, and optimize NLP pipelines for deployment at scale in production environments.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate NLP solutions into broader systems and applications.
Stay up-to-date with the latest NLP research and trends, incorporating state-of-the-art techniques into our solutions. Technical Skills:
Python
Java
NLTK
PyTorch
LSTMs
Pandas
SQL
Git


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator


LinkedIn
Mail

Title: Solver - Generative AI Specialist
Description:
About Exsolv√¶:

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation, providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services tailored to empower its partners and address their unique challenges. We tackle complex challenges with a holistic approach, fostering collaboration across diverse expertise areas, including Data Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Governance.




Our "Solvers" are passionate professionals empowered by cutting-edge tools, a culture of knowledge sharing, and continuous learning opportunities. We are seeking a Generative AI Specialist to join our team of experts, helping our clients leverage the power of advanced AI technologies to transform their operations.




Your Role:

As a Generative AI Specialist, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and clients to design, develop, and deploy innovative AI solutions, with a particular focus on generative models and their applications.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications (Mandatory)

Educational Background: Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or related fields.
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience including at least 2 in the aforementioned specialty
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Technical Expertise: Proven experience with generative AI frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, Hugging Face, or similar.
Programming Proficiency: Advanced skills in Python and familiarity with AI libraries such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying AI models.
Communication Skills: Strong ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Skills

Experience in fine-tuning and customizing large language models (LLMs).
Familiarity with agent-based systems for task automation.
Knowledge of MLOps tools and best practices for AI model deployment and monitoring.
Strong business acumen to align AI solutions with strategic goals.




What You‚Äôll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Collaboration: Engage with clients to identify business needs, explore AI opportunities, and deliver tailored solutions leveraging generative AI.
Use Case Development: Analyze client challenges to propose and implement generative AI applications such as text generation, image synthesis, content creation, or workflow automation.




Technical Implementation

Model Development: Design, build, and fine-tune generative AI models using frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, and Hugging Face.
Agent Design: Create agent-based architectures for real-time decision-making and task automation.
Integration: Connect generative AI systems with external tools, APIs, and enterprise systems to optimize workflow and performance.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on the latest advancements in generative AI and contribute to internal R&D initiatives.
Experiment with emerging models, techniques, and tools to ensure cutting-edge solutions for clients.




Project Management

Plan, execute, and oversee the delivery of AI projects, ensuring timely and high-quality outcomes.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure smooth project integration.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients to empower their teams with generative AI capabilities.
Provide ongoing support for deployed solutions to ensure scalability and optimization.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse and innovative AI projects across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Benefit from the latest GenAI tools as well as an annual budget for certifications, training, and conferences to stay ahead in your field.
Collaborative Environment: Join a team that values collective intelligence and a supportive culture.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model that offers remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Package: Attractive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

Title: Data Scientist - Banking
Description:
Who We Are

NORRIQ is an international organization headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to driving business transformation through innovative technology.

Our expanding Financial Services (FS) practice includes a team of 100+ specialists committed to helping banks and financial institutions adapt to evolving client demands, adopt cutting-edge technologies, and navigate complex regulatory environments.

At NORRIQ, we believe our people are our greatest asset. We cultivate a culture of innovation, growth, and excellence, offering tailored training, opportunities for advancement, and a strong sense of community. Join us on this remarkable journey and become a valued member of the NORRIQ family‚Äîconnected for life!

The Opportunity

NORRIQ FS is seeking a Senior/Medior Data Scientist to drive our data analytics and machine learning initiatives while delivering innovative solutions to our financial services clients.

Roles & Responsibilities

Client-Facing Responsibilities:


Design and implement machine learning solutions for complex business problems
Conduct exploratory data analysis and create insightful visualizations
Develop and maintain data pipelines for model deployment
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions
Provide technical guidance on data science best practices


Technical Responsibilities


Develop and maintain ML models using scikit-learn and other Python libraries
Implement version control for both code and data using GitLab and DVC
Create and maintain Jupyter notebooks for analysis and documentation
Ensure reproducibility of data science workflows
Optimize existing models and data pipelines for improved performance
Follow ML ops best practices for model deployment and monitoring


Internal Contributions


Contribute to NORRIQ's data science expertise through knowledge sharing
Participate in proposal writing and solution architecture
Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance
Stay current with latest developments in data science and ML


Your Profile

Experience : 2-6 years in the following areas:


Professional experience as a data scientist or ML engineer
Proven track record of implementing ML solutions in production
Experience with financial services industry preferred
Strong background in statistical analysis and machine learning


Technical Skills


Expert in Python programming and data science libraries
Proficiency with scikit-learn, pandas, and numpy
Experience with version control (GitLab) and DVC
Strong knowledge of Jupyter Lab and notebook-based development
Understanding of ML ops and deployment practices
Experience with SQL and data manipulation
Education: Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Languages: Fluency in English, and Dutch or French, with at least passive knowledge of the other


What NORRIQ Offers You


Be part of a fast-growing, international organization with a unique and people-centered culture
Enjoy a highly competitive compensation package, including a company car, iPhone, and additional allowances
Access extensive training programs in Belgium and Denmark, focusing on both technical expertise and soft skills
Work with a dynamic and diverse team of experienced professionals and young talent in a collaborative environment within the financial services sector


Join NORRIQ to elevate your career, contribute to transformative projects, and make a lasting impact in the financial services industry!
Show more

Title: Job | Data Scientist AI Lab | Brussel
Description:
Omschrijving

Door machine learning (ML) en artifici√´le intelligentie (AI) te gebruiken genereer je datagestuurde producten en breng je de meest urgente zakelijke uitdagingen tot een goed einde.

De job in een notendop

Je werkt in het AI Lab binnen een jong, vernieuwend en dynamisch team om transversale AI-projecten end-to-end te realiseren.

Je gebruikt diverse soorten data ‚Äì interne en externe, gestructureerde en ongestructureerde ‚Äì om bestaande use cases te verbeteren en nieuwe use cases op te starten. Dat kan voor alle bank- en verzekeringsactiviteiten: marketing, compliance, fraude, procesautomatisering‚Ä¶

Wat je doet, is heel divers:


Je bouwt/verbetert voorspellende modellen met behulp van statistische technieken en machine learning.
Je gebruikt large language models of andere generatieve AI modellen om concrete oplossingen te bieden voor business-noden.
Je maakt, analyseert en interpreteert businesshypotheses en benut datasets.
Je beveelt de business idee√´n aan wanneer er data/resultaten beschikbaar zijn aan de hand van visualisaties/voorspellende algoritmes.
Je helpt gebruikers om inzicht te verwerven in de principes van datawetenschap en je licht indien nodig de gedragingen van het model en mogelijke corrigerende acties toe.



Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel √©√©n worden. Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan indien je voldoet aan de volgende voorwaarden:


Een master of doctoraat in de wetenschappen met uitstekende academische resultaten op technisch gebied (econometrie, computerwetenschappen, artifici√´le intelligentie, e.a.).
Deskundigheid op het vlak van machine learning technieken en bereidheid om die kennis up-to-date te houden; een diepgaande kennis van algoritmes zoals Random Forests, Neural Networks en Reinforcement Learning is hierbij een must.
Ervaring met het toepassen van Generative AI modellen zoals large language models.
Sterke programmeervaardigheden in Python en SQL en noties van MLOps & CI/CD.
Uitgebreide kennis van Nederlands of Frans, met passieve kennis van de andere taal, en Engels.
Ervaring in het verklaren van complexe analyses aan een niet-technisch publiek aan de hand van je verhalende competenties en je capaciteit om data te visualiseren; je beschikt over uitmuntende mondelinge en schriftelijke communicatievaardigheden op technisch en businessniveau.
Honger naar kennis, niet alleen om nieuwe algoritmes en technologie√´n te beheersen, maar ook op interpersoonlijk vlak; je bent je ervan bewust dat de waarde van jouw werk neerkomt op kwaliteit x acceptatie en je wilt sleutelen aan beide aspecten.
Uitzonderlijke probleemoplossende vaardigheden: je weet dat het juiste inzicht in een probleem minstens 90% van de oplossing uitmaakt, je geeft blijk van creativiteit en volharding bij het doorgronden van problemen en het zoeken van oplossingen.



Je scoort extra met:


Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans).
Ervaring met het bouwen van data- en softwareproducten, van ontwerp tot productie.
Eerdere ervaring met Natural Language Processing.
Kennis van Spark en libraries/tools voor visualisatie (zoals Plotly/Dash of React).
Noties van cloud, bij voorkeur Azure.



Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:


Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carri√®rekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
Een goede werk-priv√© balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen
Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

Show more

Title: AI Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company's premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Tasks:

  • Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data;
  • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques;
  • Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language;
  • Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
  • Define data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality and integrity;
  • Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance;
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods;
  • Design the IT architecture for solitons in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and coordinate its implementation considering master- and meta-data management concepts;
  • Contributing for the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and derive the IT requirements;
  • Contributing to the design of the IT architecture considering master- and meta-data management concepts


Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 15 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • At least 15 years of experience with JAVA;
  • At least 5 years of experience with Python;
  • At least 3 years of experience with OpenAPI;
  • At least 3 years of experience with LLM, RAG, feature learning and semantic search;
  • At least 3 years of experience in deploying and managing AI applications and models in public cloud environments;
  • At least 2 years of experience with LangChain;
  • Excellent command in English


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18043/01/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading European Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc). We design and develop software applications using integrated, state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, age, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerci√´le B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat betekent:


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je herkent jezelf in de volgende competenties:


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe idee√´n helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerci√´le strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast kan je rekenen op:


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en priv√© dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in Belgi√´, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega‚Äôs.

What‚Äôs next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over de selectieprocedure:

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

Title: AI engineer Consultant
Description:
The team, position & mission:




Are you passionate about data? Do you like creating a real impact by tackling some real-world problems our clients face by developing algorithms for recommendation engines, developing natural language processing algorithms or employing deep learning methods on information? If you answered yes, this could be the job for you! As an AI engineer, your job will be to propose and develop advanced analytical models for a series of different clients and in different industries like life science, media, public, banking, insurance and others.




Your key areas of responsibility as AI engineer Consultant:




Proposing and developing advanced analytical models for a series of different clients and in different industries like life science, media, public, banking, insurance and others.
Working as a consultant for big clients, accompanied by your colleague experts in the field. An analytical career path will help you to develop your skills and obtain your objectives on the long term.




As an ideal candidate you have:




A master‚Äôs degree or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Engineering, Physics or any related field
2-5 years relevant experience in data science / data analysis / data mining
Passionate about data and/or statistical analysis, with mathematics and modelling skills
Experience in at least one of the following sectors: Banking, Finance, Risk, Marketing, Customer Intelligence, Life Sciences
Experience with SQL
Some experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, ...) is a plus
Experience with applying regression, classification, natural language processing, clustering/ segmentation, time-series forecasting, anomaly detection or predictive maintenance is a must
Proficiency in data sourcing (web-scraping, API, etc.), data transformation and data preparation techniques
Excellent programming knowledge in Python and/or R
Good coding practices and code refactoring experience is an advantage
Interest in machine learning, deep learning and/or MLOps
Experience using Cloud Data Platforms (Azure, GCP, ...) for Data Science projects is a plus
Ability to understand the business requirements and develop new/existing algorithms to satisfy those requirements
Strong communication and presentation skills
Being able to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience and explainable AI is an advantage
Conceptual and creative thinking
A plus: Hands on experience in Enterprise Intelligence (e.g., Data Warehousing, Data Management, Business Intelligence, Analytics, Big Data ecosystem)
Fluent in English and French and/or Dutch
Experience in using tools leveraging Generative AI and/or developing yourself projects that make use of Generative AI is a plus




What we offer you:




Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
We may work with tomorrow‚Äôs technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
Read more about the benefits we offer here




About Orange Business:

Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.




Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.




With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.

Title: Data Engineering Internship
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Are you passionate about technology and eager to kick-start your career in data engineering?

Join P&G as a Data Engineering Intern and be part of a dynamic team that harnesses groundbreaking technology to transform data into actionable insights. You will have the opportunity to work on innovative projects that directly impact our operations and contribute to the efficiency and sustainability of one of the largest consumer goods companies in the world. You will also work closely with our data engineering and analytics teams to develop robust data pipelines and support data-driven decision-making across the organization.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G‚ÄôS SUCCESS:


Data Pipeline Development: Assist in designing, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines to ensure seamless integration of data from various sources.
Data Management: Support data quality initiatives by monitoring and improving data integrity and availability across systems.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Data Analytics: Use data analytics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for process improvements within the supply chain and manufacturing sectors.
Tool Development: Contribute to the development of data tools and dashboards that visualize insights and enhance decision-making.
Learning & Growth: Participate in training sessions and mentorship programs to enhance your technical skills and understanding of data engineering best practices.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


Pursuing a Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, SQL, or R.
Basic knowledge of data management and data analytics concepts.
Strong analytical skills and a passion for problem-solving.
Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with diverse teams.
A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn new technologies and methodologies.


YOUR ADVANTAGES:


A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours;
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Data Reporting & Visualization
Description:
üíºJob Title: Data Reporting & Visualization

üë®‚ÄçüíªJob Type: Contract

üë®‚ÄçüíªWho can apply: Freelancers

üìçLocation: Brussels Belgium

üìçLanguage: English, French and Dutch

üíºWork regime: Hybrid (2 days/week onsite)

üî•Keywords: Data Visualization, Data Reporting, SAS, Adobe Analytics, SQL, Tableau




Sector: Our client is a prominent player in the financial sector, recognized for its comprehensive range of banking and financial services. With a global presence, it serves a diverse clientele, including individuals, corporations, and institutions. Emphasizing innovation and customer-centricity, it leverages advanced technologies to deliver tailored solutions that meet the evolving needs of its stakeholders.




Position Overview:

We are looking for a performance analyst to reinforce the Measurement and Performance team within the Marketing & Communication department.

The mission of the team is to measure, analyze and optimize the effectiveness of marketing and communication campaigns against objectives and benchmarks, provide actionable data-driven insights and attribute ROI to optimize future marketing and communication strategy and/or initiatives.

We develop critical building blocks, ensure E2E and consolidated as well as individual campaign reporting for stakeholders and management and embed a data-driven decision-making culture within the Marketing & Communications organization.




What you'll do:

Drives data-driven decision making by analysing campaign performance and providing actionable insights to optimize marketing strategies

Develops and maintains dashboards, reports and metrics to measure campaign effectiveness, customer behaviour and market trends

Identifies areas of improvement and recommends data-driven solutions to enhance customer experience, conversion rates and revenue growth

Foster a culture of data driven decision making

Documenting and training users on how to effectively use the different tools.

Data visualization tools: Tableau

Adobe analytics

SAS

SQL

Excel




What you bring:

At least 5 years of relevant experience in performance analysis in the digital and financial sector. You have a good understanding of a wide range of marketing, campaign performance and communications disciplines.

Marketing Analytical skills and competences:

Data analysis: collect, consolidate, analyze and interpret large datasets to identify actionable recommendations.

You have a good understanding of data monitoring mechanisms, tag management systems and data integration.

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We're not just another tech company; we're revolutionizing how millions of people experience their digital experience.

At Nexthink, we‚Äôre the pioneers of Digital Employee Experience (DEX) technology. Using a powerful mix of real-time analytics, clever automation, and cutting-edge AI and Machine Learning, we're helping some of the world's biggest companies create digital workplaces that delight their employees at work. Think of us as the architects of the future workplace!

We‚Äôre a team of passionate tech enthusiasts, problem solvers, and innovators. At Nexthink, collaboration is key‚Äîwe encourage curiosity, creativity, and bold thinking. If you love solving real-world challenges and want to be part of an exciting growth journey, you might just be the Nexthinker we‚Äôre looking for!

Are you passionate about AI and eager to turn that enthusiasm into real-world impact? Do you want to learn from experienced AI engineers while working on cutting-edge solutions? If so, this is your opportunity to join Nexthink as a Junior AI Engineer!

As a Junior AI Engineer, you‚Äôll be part of a dynamic and collaborative AI team, gaining hands-on experience in building AI solutions deployed on the cloud with an impact on millions of employees worldwide.

This role offers an incredible opportunity to:


Build your expertise in modern AI technologies (LLM, AI agents, ‚Ä¶) and frameworks (Python, Langchain, ‚Ä¶)
Learn how to develop scalable and resilient software in a cloud production-environment
Contribute to meaningful projects that impact our customers
Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team where questions are encouraged
Grow your career with mentorship from experienced AI and software engineers


If you're ready to start your journey in AI engineering and are excited about learning while doing so, we want to hear from you!

Even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply. We value potential and enthusiasm just as much as experience!

Qualifications

We're not expecting you to know everything! What we're looking for is:


MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, ML or related field
A solid foundation in AI, ML and software engineering
Genuine curiosity about building cloud product at scale and enthusiasm for solving real-world problems
Strong willingness to learn and adapt
Clear communication skills (English) with technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing


Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

üíº Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

üìç Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

üèñÔ∏è Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

ü§∏ Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

üöû Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

üßë‚Äçüè´ Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

ü§ù Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

üì£ Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

üöö We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:-

‚Ä¢ Master's degree in Computer Science, Communication Systems, or a related field

‚Ä¢ Extensive experience in software development, with proficiency in multiple modern programming languages, incl. Python

‚Ä¢ Strong expertise in Machine Learning, Data Science techniques and mastery of the pandas library.

‚Ä¢ Proven track record of at least 12 months working with ChatGPT or equivalent conversational AI platforms

‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of API development and integration

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to work autonomously while fostering teamwork and collaboration

‚Ä¢ Excellent problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a meticulous attention to detail

‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills and the ability to liaise effectively with clients and team members alike




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Conduct cutting-edge research on AI and ML techniques, with a focus on generative AI, and Large Language Models (LLMs)

‚Ä¢ Stay up-to-date with and share expertise in prompt engineering strategies, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques, and agentic approaches

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams, incl. business stakeholders, to translate user needs, pain points and opportunities, into tailored AI solutions for our business

‚Ä¢ Lead the development and deployment of these innovative solutions, working iteratively and responding to user feedback

‚Ä¢ Be comfortable in quickly prototyping solutions that can be tested by users, as well as in producing high-quality code for enterprise solutions

‚Ä¢ Contribute to establishing best practices in coding, testing and software design for LLM applications

‚Ä¢ Mentor and support the professional growth of junior AI engineers and data scientists

‚Ä¢ Foster a collaborative and innovative environment, encouraging knowledge sharing and continuous learning

Description:
We're seeking a skilled and passionate Data Scientist to join a dynamic team with our client based in the Zurich area.




In this exciting role, you'll be part of an international team, playing a key part in shaping and developing an innovative product that makes a real impact.




If you have a degree in a related field, 5+ years of experience in data science, a strong grasp of statistics, and exceptional Python skills, we want to hear from you! Fluency in German is a big plus, and experience with SQL, Spark, and MLOps will set you apart.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Scientist
Description:
Are you looking to work at the forefront of Machine Learning and AI? Would you be excited to apply cutting-edge Generative AI algorithms to solve real-world problems with significant impact?

The AI Scientist Group at Applied Data Science Center at IQVIA is a strategic team that helps pharmaceutical companies and related institutions in life sciences implement AIML solutions and realize transformational business opportunities. This is a team of AI scientists, consultants and engineers working step-by-step with customers to build bespoke solutions that harness the power of machine learning and Generative AI.

The team helps pharmaceutical customers imagine and scope the use cases that will create the greatest value for their businesses, select, train, and fine-tune the right models, define paths to navigate technical or business challenges, develop proof-of-concepts, and make plans for launching solutions at scale.

Key Responsibilities:



Collaborate with internal teams and work directly with pharmaceutical/life sciences institutions to identify and address business needs with Generative AI applications.
Design and conduct experiments, research new algorithms, and innovate to optimize risk, profitability, and customer experience.
Develop, implement, and refine advanced Generative AI models to solve complex, novel problems.
Work with a multidisciplinary team to build and deploy scalable AI solutions.
Create proof-of-concepts and prototypes to showcase the potential of Generative AI technologies.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in Generative AI and machine learning, applying them to practical scenarios.
Provide technical leadership and mentorship to team members.
Present and explain AI solutions to non-technical stakeholders in customer-facing roles.
Apply consulting principles to deliver tailored AI solutions that meet specific client needs.


Required Qualifications and Skills:



Advanced degree (Ph.D. or Master‚Äôs) in Computer Science or a related field.
Proven experience in designing and implementing Generative AI models and algorithms.
Strong programming skills in Python, with hands-on experience in frameworks such as PyTorch, LangChain, GraphRAG, AutoGen, and various vector/graph databases (e.g., ChromaDB, Neo4j).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure) and deploying machine learning models at scale, including Azure OpenAI Services.
Fine-tune and distill large language models to improve performance and efficiency
Deep understanding of standard machine learning techniques and cutting-edge Generative AI technologies.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think creatively and critically.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, capable of explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in customer-facing roles with strong consulting skills to understand and solve client needs.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Desire to work in a collaborative environment.


IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Data Scientist (Risk)
Description:
About CloudWalk:

We are not just another fintech unicorn. We are a pack of dreamers, makers, and tech enthusiasts building the future of payments. With millions of happy customers and a hunger for innovation, we're now expanding our neural network - literally and metaphorically.

About The Team:

The Risk Team is responsible for building the defense layer that keeps CloudWalk, its merchants, and users safe. We keep our ecosystem healthy by tracking down malicious activity and maintaining regulatory compliance while providing the best user experience. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team comprising risk analysts, data scientists, and software engineers, working collaboratively to enhance our risk management strategies.

About The Job:

As a Data Scientist on our Risk Team, your role is crucial in developing and optimizing machine learning models to detect and prevent fraud. You will be a key player in analyzing data, building predictive models, and implementing robust data-driven strategies to enhance our risk management processes.

You will bridge the gap between theoretical data science and practical, scalable solutions in the fintech sector, with a specific focus on risk assessment and mitigation. Your work will involve handling large-scale datasets, extracting meaningful insights, and developing sophisticated algorithms to protect our ecosystem.

What You'll Need to Succeed:


Fluency in Python and SQL.
Proficient in ML libraries like Scikit, PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
Experience with cloud-based services like the Google Cloud platform.
Solid Data Visualization skills to create charts and dashboards.
Strong analytical skills, ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Detail-oriented with a strong research mindset.
As a member of a fully remote and distributed team, you are expected to complete tasks autonomously, being highly collaborative and self-driven. We expect you to have the curiosity of a child with the responsibility of a grown-up.
Communication skills. You should be able to communicate effectively with multiple teams.
Ability to communicate and debate in English and Portuguese.


Nice-to-have skills:


Experience with financial or payment industry.
Knowledge of distributed systems and parallel computing.
DevOps practices: Understanding DevOps practices, including continuous integration, continuous deployment, and containerization.


The Future We See:

At CloudWalk, we envision a future where AI empowers every field to reach new heights:


People teams leveraging AI to transform talent acquisition and employee development.
Marketing professionals creating data-driven, AI-powered campaign strategies.
Customer Success teams enhancing client experiences with intelligent solutions.
Risk analysts combining human expertise with AI to navigate complexities.
Designers collaborating with AI to push creative boundaries.


Join us at CloudWalk, where we‚Äôre not just engineering solutions; we‚Äôre building a smarter, AI-driven future for payments‚Äîtogether.

Title: AI Research Scientist
Description:
Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Within AI Platform, the Multimodal Intelligence team empowers developers and data scientists around the world and of all skill levels to easily add multimodal AI capabilities to their apps. We are looking for a research Scientist to work on exciting challenges in Document Understanding and Computer Vision. #aiplatform

We are particularly interested in candidates with background in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing and/or Artificial Intelligence, including topics like Video Understanding, multi-page multi-document question answering, novel ways of leveraging large language models for document understanding and solving problems inherent to large language models (grounding, retrieval-based generation, etc.) and other Multimodal topics. Familiarity with modern large language models is a plus, but not required.

Responsibilities


Identifies and articulates problems in an area of research that may impact business opportunities.
Advances a research agenda through one or more research projects, yielding new algorithms, prototypes, theories, tools, methods, analyses, insights, or collections of data in one or more subareas or a broad area of research.
Masters one or more subareas (e.g., Object Recognition, Text Classification) and gains expertise in a broad area of research (e.g., Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Document Understanding); understands the corresponding literature, applicable research techniques, and academic context.
Collaborates with other relevant researchers or research groups to contribute to or advance a research agenda. Publishes papers as lead author for high-quality conferences and journals.
Partners and collaborates with other teams on related deliverables, and leverages others in relevant work streams.


Qualifications

Required Qualifications:


Doctorate in Computer Science or relevant field.
OR equivalent experience.
Fluency in English.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong algorithmic problem solving and software development skills (Python, C/C++, etc.).‚ÄØ
Experience with LLMs/LMMS, and open-source tools such as PyTorch, etc
Publication(s) in top-tier conferences or journals in related fields (e.g., CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NIPS, ICML, ICLR, IJCV, PAMI, etc.).


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Especialista em Ci√™ncia de Dados (Intelig√™ncia Artificial)
HTML:
Vamos falar sobre a Loggi? üíô


Somos uma empresa de tecnologia que est√° reinventando a log√≠stica e a forma de fazer entregas no Brasil.

Queremos empoderar pessoas e transformar neg√≥cios com entregas de excel√™ncia. Movimentamos mais de 400 mil pacotes por dia com uma tecnologia de ponta a ponta, que aproxima todos os cantos do pa√≠s.

Temos o prop√≥sito de que as entregas sejam acess√≠veis para todas as pessoas do Brasil. Esse √© nosso desafio di√°rio, por isso, buscamos inova√ß√£o em tudo que fazemos. 

Por aqui, valorizamos diferentes formas de pensar, pois sabemos que s√≥ assim poderemos criar um futuro mais democr√°tico para as pessoas.

Nossa Cultura


Nossa cultura √© traduzida todos os dias pelos comportamentos de cada Logger e das experi√™ncias que constru√≠mos com os nossos clientes e sociedade. 


Somos conduzidos por quatro valores: Criamos o futuro, Entregamos solu√ß√µes simples, Comunicamos abertamente e Vivemos o diferente. Eles s√£o como um guia de como as pessoas devem se comportar diante das pequenas e grandes atitudes tomadas no nosso ambiente de trabalho diariamente.

Nosso time de Dados


As equipes de Engenharia e Dados da Loggi s√£o apaixonadas por desafios e buscam escalar um neg√≥cio transformador em um ambiente de constante aprendizado. Nosso compromisso com a excel√™ncia impulsiona a cria√ß√£o de sistemas eficientes e a otimiza√ß√£o de processos, resultando em uma plataforma log√≠stica inovadora. Atuamos em desafios de alta complexidade, combinando a expertise de profissionais experientes e talentos em in√≠cio de carreira, fortalecendo nosso ambiente por meio do aprendizado cont√≠nuo e do compartilhamento de conhecimento.

Usamos tecnologia para resolver problemas de efici√™ncia e operacionaliza√ß√£o, al√©m de produzirmos uma solu√ß√£o de coletas e entregas din√¢mica e √∫nica. Temos tamb√©m desafios em maximizar o sucesso de entrega e construir mecanismos de pagamento justos aos nossos entregadores.

Estamos √† procura de um(a) Especialista em Ci√™ncia de Dados para integrar a Ger√™ncia de Intelig√™ncia Artificial, contribuindo para o desenvolvimento e execu√ß√£o de projetos estrat√©gicos com impacto direto nos resultados da empresa. 


Requirements


  • Gradua√ß√£o em Ci√™ncia de Dados, Estat√≠stica, Engenharia, Matem√°tica ou √°reas correlatas;
  • Experi√™ncia comprovada em an√°lise de dados e modelagem estat√≠stica/Machine Learning;

  • Conhecimento desej√°vel nos frameworks: Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Langchain, Langgraph
  • Excelente comunica√ß√£o para traduzir conceitos t√©cnicos a p√∫blicos n√£o t√©cnicos;
  • Proatividade e capacidade de trabalhar de forma aut√¥noma;
  • Habilidade para resolver problemas de forma anal√≠tica e eficaz;
  • Mentalidade de aprendizado cont√≠nuo e busca por inova√ß√£o;

Responsabilidades

  • Propor solu√ß√µes inovadoras e sustent√°veis para otimiza√ß√£o de processos;

Benefits

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (MLOps)
Description:
Global leader in lightweight and sustainable construction, Saint-Gobain designs, manufactures, and distributes materials and services for the construction and industrial markets. Its integrated solutions for renovation, lightweight construction, and decarbonization of the construction and industry sectors are developed through a continuous innovation process and promote sustainability and performance.




Want to be part of this team?




Required Knowledge:

¬∑ Proficiency in Python, SQL e PySpark.

¬∑ Solid experience in model development, deployment, and maintenance.

¬∑ Strong knowledge of machine learning models, including both predictive and generative models.

¬∑ Experience with cloud platforms: Azure, Databricks, Snowflake, Terraform.

¬∑ Expertise in tools such as Streamlit, ML Flow, Grafana and DataDog for implementing and maintaining models in production.

¬∑ Familiarity with CI/CD practices for machine learning and model deployment, including Docker containerization.

¬∑ Expertise in on-premise server deployment as well as cloud-based deployment.

¬∑ Familiarity with industrial automation systems, including SCADA, IoT, and PLC systems.

¬∑ Knowledge of cybersecurity concepts.




Main Activities:

¬∑ Work closely with Data Scientists to deploy, monitor, and optimize models in production.

¬∑ Develop, optimize, and maintain ETL processes for model and data integration.

¬∑ Collaborate with IT and OT teams to deploy models and applications, integrating with industrial systems such as SCADA, PLC, and IoT.

¬∑ Build and deploy applications and APIs for model interaction and visualization.

¬∑ Automate model deployment and monitoring pipelines, ensuring scalability and efficiency, through CI/CD best practices.

¬∑ Provide best practices for the maintenance and monitoring of deployed models in production environments.

¬∑ Ensure security best practices are followed in the deployment and operation of models, focusing on IT and OT cybersecurity aspects.

Title: Data Scientist - Payments Risk
HTML:
About The Team

DS team is spread across US, Amsterdam, Brazil, and India and is primarily focused on managing global losses across LoBs with real-time strategies. We balance loss rate with action rate to both make attackers pursue other avenues and allow good affected users to have proceed. The key questions we ask ourselves daily: "How exactly did this attacker bypass our layered defence?" and "What is the best sustainable way to prevent this from scaling?"

We run product rollouts (e.g. a new user challenge or a new kind of actioning) and implement models built by MLEng.

What The Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points

---- What the Candidate Will Do ----

Title: Machine Learning Engineering Specialist
HTML:
EBANX is the leading payment platform connecting global companies with customers from the fastest-growing digital markets in the world.

Since the beginning of our journey, we have had one mission: to provide global access for everyone. We believe that transforming challenges into opportunities and making the impossible part of the journey is crucial! That's precisely why we created a payment technology that builds bridges between people and businesses every day in 29 rising markets across the globe.

We call ourselves ebankers, we are global thinkers, we value diversity, we foster creativity and we work hard to connect businesses and people worldwide through payments. Let's make history together?

As a Data Scientist Specialist focused on MLOPs your mission will be to own the design and deployment of scalable systems to train, monitor, and expose machine learning models in production.

You will also be responsible for:

  • Owning the design of system architecture to train, retrain, develop, monitor, and expose machine learning models;
  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable infrastructure for ML pipelines and APIs;
  • Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines for ML model deployment, updates, and continuous monitoring;
  • Collaborate closely with data scientists, software engineers, and cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of ML models into production;
  • Ensure compliance with security and privacy requirements, particularly in a financial context;
  • Troubleshoot and optimize ML production systems, ensuring performance, reliability, and scalability;
  • Share knowledge, mentor, and support team members in best practices for MLOps, API development, and productionization of machine learning models.

What we are looking for:

  • Experience in MLOps, DevOps, or related roles;
  • Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure);
  • Proficiency in containerization tools like Docker and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes);
  • Familiarity with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn);
  • Strong Python skills with experience in writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code;
  • Experience with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions);
  • Knowledge of data pipelines and ETL processes (streaming and batch);
  • Experience in monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions for ML services (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, DataDog);
  • Understanding of security and compliance standards in payment systems.

What else would we like to see?

  • Knowledge of Kafka or similar event streaming platforms.
  • Familiarity with financial services or payment systems.

EBANX offers:

  • Spanish, English, and Portuguese classes;
  • Meal Allowance;
  • Transportation voucher (if needed);
  • WAVES - Program of goals and results (variable compensation);
  • EBANX Play - Wellness (Gympass, e-Sports, SESC );
  • EBANX Education: financial support for undergraduate, graduate, and MBA programs so you can develop important skills for your career;
  • EBANX Skills: budget for workshops and courses;
  • EBANX Flexible: Birthday Day Off;
  • Semi-flexible hours (8 hours a day - Monday to Friday);
  • EBANX Family: Daycare assistance, extended leave for caregivers and support program for children and pregnant women;
  • EBANX Health: Health and Dental Insurance, with subsidy for dependents and medicine subsidy for ebankers;
  • Life Insurance: Life Insurance 100% paid by EBANX;
  • Blue Club: Exclusive discount for ebankers in bakeries, restaurants, courses, electronics stores, and more!

Follow us on LinkedIn and check out our Instagram to learn more about the #ebanxlife.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist Location: Brazil Contract type: temporary (3+ months), fully remote. POSITION SUMMARY: Data Meaning is a front-runner in Business Intelligence and Data Analytics consulting, renowned for our high-quality consulting services throughout the US and LATAM. Our expertise lies in delivering tailored solutions in Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, and Project Management. As a Tableau Preferred Partner and the distinguished Alteryx 2020 Global Partner of the Year, we are dedicated to bringing premier services to our diverse clientele. Our strength lies in our global team of 95+ consultants, all working remotely, embodying a collaborative, inclusive, and innovation-driven work culture. We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. This position focuses on building models in Python that are executed within the Snowflake platform using Snowpark.The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in Python, a clear understanding of Snowflake architecture, and a background in developing predictive and statistical models, with experience in the marketing industry. RESPONSIBILITIES: Developrobust models in Python, leveraging Snowflake and Snowpark for deployment and execution. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering and architecture, to ensure seamless model integration and deployment. Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights that address complex business challenges. Build predictive models and propose innovative solutions using appropriate statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms. Communicate results and insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including senior management and clients. Ensure data integrity, address imperfections in datasets, and integrate varied structured and semi-structured data sources. Implement solid validation processes to minimize errors and enhance model accuracy and reliability. Identify meaningful data visualizations to communicate findings and highlight business impact. Stay up to date on advancements in data science, Snowflake, and Python to champion innovative approaches and tools. REQUIREMENTS: At least 4 years of professional experience in data science, analytics, or a related field. Strong proficiency in Python, including experience building models for execution within Snowflake using Snowpark. Knowledge of Snowflake architecture and its integration with Python for data science use cases. Understanding of machine learning and predictive analytics concepts, including supervised and unsupervised learning techniques. Strong analytical skills with the ability to draw actionable insights from complex datasets. Familiarity with SQL for querying databases; NoSQL knowledge is a plus. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present technical information to non-technical audiences. Ability to work in a collaborative, remote environment with a focus on delivering high-quality solutions. Familiarity with marketing data science problems like customer segmentation, personalization, churn analysis, dynamic pricing optimization, visual merchandising optimization, demand forecasting with seasonality, and marketing campaign performance forecasting. Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field (Master‚Äôs degree preferred). Nice to have: Experience with Alteryx. Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure (Preferred), AWS, or GCP. Food service and specialty retail industry Prior experience working in consulting or client-facing roles. Understanding of big data infrastructure like Hadoop, Spark, or similar technologies. Powered by JazzHR
